name: Caf√© Marcel
address: 28 Ngo Quang Huy, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Breakfast & Brunch All-Day in Thao Dien. At Caf√© Marcel, we do everything ourselves, from scratch. Chef Brian Chu selects only the best products, sourced locally from trusted suppliers. Homemade and fresh, that‚Äôs how we like it at Caf√© Marcel.
example_reviews: Today I went to meet a friend at Cafe Marcel. Stepping from a busy street I was instantly greeted by friendly staff and a relaxing environment. As it was my first time going there, the server politely explained both the food and drink menu and allowed me time to make my choices. I was promptly given my drink and without being rushed given a generous plate of food. The house made sausages had the perfect level of spice and my eggs were perfect for dipping the crunchy sourdough toast. All in all I can not recommend this place enough. Great addition to Saigon if you‚Äôre looking for a meeting point or delicious, fresh breakfast!

Amazing breakfast!!! The first time we went we were served by giang and the second time by phuong both were really lovely and helpful explaining the breakfast menu which is great value by the way. You can choose your eggs then your bread and sauce etc, they also have a really good brunch deal. The portions were really big and the food and iced coffee was so so good, would highly reccommend!

This little cafe popped up in the search when we were looking for a flavorful meal on our last day in HCMC and it didn't disappoint. This is a tiny little cafe with seating on the first floor. Interiors are beautifully done and the staff is very courteous. Food items we had were Spicy Shakshuka, avocado tartine & iced phin coffee. Shakshuka wasn't very spicy, just the right amount for beautiful flavors. Avocado tartine was full of fresh avocado mash and cheese. And the coffee was just the right companion to top the entire meal. I would say it's the perfect place for breakfast/brunch. Prices are a little high as compared to other food options in the vicinity - but absolutely worth it...

name: Tung's Restaurant
address: 230 ƒê. L√™ Th√°nh T√¥n Ph∆∞·ªùng B·∫øn Th√†nh, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Welcome to Tung's Restaurant - Vietnamese Cuisine & vegetarian Food, a premier Vietnamese restaurant in the heart of Saigon. Celebrated for our authentic Vietnamese cuisine, we offer a diverse menu that highlights the rich flavors of Northern Vietnam. At Tung's, we cater to all tastes with our extensive restaurant food selection, featuring hearty breakfast options, delicious lunch and dinner plates, and a variety of selectable vegetarian dishes. As a top choice among vegetarian restaurants, we delight both vegetarians and non-vegetarians alike. Experience the aromatic and intricate tastes of Vietnamese food at Tung's, where every dish is crafted to perfection. Join us for a memorable culinary journey that brings the essence of Northern Vietnamese cuisine to your table.
example_reviews: Try raw egg coffee for the first time and it's mellow. Beef rolls are also delicious, and it's the first time you've tried this way. The service like üíïSIM is warm, speaks Chinese and English, and introduces the culture and hanging pictures of the restaurant. Overall, the restaurant's environment is also comfortable, full of Vietnamese flair and attentive to the needs of each guest.

We were welcome warmly by the staff and the atmosphere was lovely! Our server Dom recommended some excellent veggie dishes and I would highly recommend the Tofu in Tomato sauce! The staff were very friendly and attentive and demonstrated how to create the bun cha rolls!

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê Highly recommended! üçΩÔ∏è Food ‚Äì 5 stars We ordered European dishes and were served exactly as we wanted. The food was excellent, taste top and the portions just right. A special surprise was the clear vegetable soup we got unsolicited ‚Äì a very nice gesture that reinforced the positive impression. üë®‚Äçüç≥ Service ‚Äì 5 stars The service was exemplary! Our waiter from the team was extremely attentive and spoke very good English. Particularly positive: Not only did he give us expert recommendations, but he also repeated the order to make sure everything fits. That's what you'd like! üßº Cleanliness ‚Äì 5 stars The restaurant was spotlessly clean ‚Äì both the floor and tables were in perfect condition. Here you can see that great importance is attached to hygiene. üöª Toilets ‚Äì 5 stars The toilets were modern and also extremely clean. This also speaks to the quality of this restaurant. ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê Conclusion An absolute recommendation for everyone who is traveling in this city! Those who value good food, excellent service and cleanliness should definitely stop by here ‚Äì it‚Äôs worth it! üíØ

name: Little HaNoi Egg Coffee
address: 119/5 Yersin Phuong Ph·∫°m Ngu Lao, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: A stunning cafe tucked away down a side street serving the best food and coffee with a great menu choice. Everything looked SO good. You get a little pot of banana and watermelon and cinnamon tea for free which is a nice touch and great if you like finishing a meal on something sweet. The staff were so lovely and kind too! There were postcards you could take home as a little keepsake (make a donation to charity). Would highly recommend here for brunch with friends/partner/solo.
example_reviews: A stunning cafe tucked away down a side street serving the best food and coffee with a great menu choice. Everything looked SO good. You get a little pot of banana and watermelon and cinnamon tea for free which is a nice touch and great if you like finishing a meal on something sweet. The staff were so lovely and kind too! There were postcards you could take home as a little keepsake (make a donation to charity). Would highly recommend here for brunch with friends/partner/solo.

This is the perfect coffee shop! Came here unexpectedly while walking the streets and couldn‚Äôt be more happy we found it. They welcomed us with a lovely refreshing glass of cinnamon tea, kindly appreciated. We ordered egg coffee, Vietnamese coffee, tuna sandwich and mango with yoghurt. It was all amazing, the egg coffee was the best I‚Äôve had by far, if you want to try it or love it already, you have to come here! The Vietnamese coffee was also excellent. The tuna sandwich was delicious and hearty, and came with a complimentary fruit pot. The mango yoghurt was so sweet and flavourful. All in all, amazing food and drinks! Nhien was such a lovely waitress, so kind and welcoming. There‚Äôs a nice view of the street, and upstairs is cosy and quiet. A perfect escape from the busy streets, with such a calm, lovely vibe. We could not recommend it enough here.

I have been coming to HCMC for many years and Little HaNoi Egg Coffee restaurants are some of my favorite places to eat. There are a number of them and they all serve great food in a pleasant environment. Previously, my favorite was avocado egg toast, but since they added eggs benedict that has been my go to favorite. They have a whole page of different versions. I, of course, pair it with egg coffee. Potato wedges are optional and make a nice addition.

name: Palsaik Korean Bbq Vietnam - ƒê√¥ng Du
address: 68-70 ƒê√¥ng Du B·∫øn Ngh√©, Qu·∫≠n 1, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Palsaik Korean BBQ l√† th∆∞∆°ng hi·ªáu ƒë∆∞·ª£c th√†nh l·∫≠p t·ª´ nƒÉm 2007, c√≥ ngu·ªìn g·ªëc t·ª´ H√†n Qu·ªëc ƒë√£ ƒë·∫°t ƒë∆∞·ª£c s·ª± ca ng·ª£i qu·ªëc t·∫ø v·ªõi h∆°n 100 ƒë·ªãa ƒëi·ªÉm tr√™n to√†n th·∫ø gi·ªõi. ƒê∆∞·ª£c bi·∫øt ƒë·∫øn v·ªõi c√°ch ti·∫øp c·∫≠n s√°ng t·∫°o, nh√† h√†ng cung c·∫•p t√°m h∆∞∆°ng v·ªã th·ªãt ba ch·ªâ ∆∞·ªõp kh√°c bi·ªát, n√¢ng cao tr·∫£i nghi·ªám BBQ truy·ªÅn th·ªëng c·ªßa H√†n Qu·ªëc.
example_reviews: Ask for Jenny! Never been to Korean BBQ. Thought we would give it a go. Wonderful experience. We ordered the meal servicing 4-6 people, it would have easily fed 6. Great selection of vegetables, pork and beef cooked at your table. The meal came with a selection of sauces, quail eggs, broccoli, zucchini and other side dishes. This was followed with a delicious sweet and sour soup with beef and mushrooms. Food was fresh and delicious. Very reasonable priced. Wonderful service and experience.

We had dinner here twice and the service was always lovely. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Food was amazing. We ordered some recommended sets which were delicious and covered meat together with soup and grilled vegies. Highly recommended!

We had never eaten Korean and this restaurant was recommended by the guide. Never regretted a moment. Yumi, our host made a delicious meal for us and made sure we felt comfortable. Absolutely recommended!

name: Laang Restaurant
address: 22 Dang Huu Pho Thao Dien, District 2, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Laang is an Asian-inspired, vegetarian-friendly restaurant in Saigon. We provide progressive urbanites an all-day healthy dining experience using fresh ingredients sourced locally. We want to build a lifestyle and a brand that emphasize on high-quality, advocates for local ingredients and celebrates authentic human connection.
example_reviews: We found this restaurant on trip advisor and we're able to get a table on fairly short notice. The menu is some 60 pages long. We chose three chef special items to share and it was plenty of food for two. We also ordered two desserts. The presentation is impressive and everything tasted good. Prices are quite reasonable.

My friends from the US were visiting Saigon for the first time - as they are vegetarian with sensitive stomachs and extremely wary of the tap water in Vietnam, I knew I had to bring them to this hidden gem in Thao Dien. In addition to the amazing and relaxing ambience, Laang has a great vegetarian option on its extensive menu. We ordered several dishes off the menu, including the stewed king oyster mushroom, grilled eggplant stuffed with shitake mushrooms, and stir-fried flat noodles with mixed mushrooms. Everything was delicious and my friends were very happy with the food. The pricing is extremely reasonable (6-15 USD / dish) given the ambience and service. If you visit, be sure to ask for Lukas who is the GM and he'll be sure to take care of you. He has deep experience working in F&B and originally worked in a Michelin rated restaurant in Europe. He's extremely knowledgeable about wines so can provide great recommendations if you're a newbie like me. Overall great restaurant with great service and great people. Couldn't recommend more highly.

Nice restaurant with romance view, nice food and perfect service. I got 110% support from staff to setup a dinner for 19 people, 1 of our guest need to use Halal food and restaurant could support me to bringing the Halal food which delivered from another restaurant. I need to deposit 6 M VND for our dinner and could get it back from restaurant within 15hours, very high prestige. 5 stars and high recommended to visit.

name: Marcel - Calmette
address: 115 Calmette Ph∆∞·ªùng Nguy·ªÖn Th√°i B√¨nh, Qu·∫≠n 1, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Marcel is a French Gourmet Burger Joint, right in the center of Saigon. At Marcel, we like our burgers the French way : unique recipes with a creative twist, using only the finest ingredients to bring burgers to a gourmet level. Our juicy patties are a secret blend of 100% Australian grass-fed beef, cooked medium rare. Our very own soft and fresh buns are home-baked twice a day. All of our sides, sauces, salads and desserts are prepared in-house. Because at the the end, Marcel is all about making sure you enjoy the best gourmet experience.
example_reviews: If you find yourself in Ho Chi Min just wanting a good ole burger then you can‚Äôt miss Marcel - Calmette Burger. In fact, you just shouldn‚Äôt miss this place period. It‚Äôs just THAT GOOD. You can get a great smash burger or there are quite a number of options with a gourmet French twist. I love my burgers and this place is high up on my list of great burger restaurants. They also served great French fries and delicious desserts like creme br√ªl√©e, creamy cheesecake with raspberry sauce and brownies. The place itself is very cute and inviting. The hostess and cashier girls were so welcoming and helpful they made the whole experience that much more enjoyable. My family and I ate here twice and If I lived in Ho Chi Minh, I would be a regular here.

Came here after doing a quick Google search. Was craving a really good burger after eating Pho for almost a month. And this is a really good burger, the bread was one of the best I've tasted, although the meat could have been a little more seasoned. Fries were also very good and the homemade chili mayo that you get for free was the icing on the cake.

Marcel the price of the cake combo includes 1 side dish and 1 water and the cheapest is about 220k, the price of the cake is about 180 in the picture, I ate 2 people with soft, delicious meat cake, the crust is very soft. But since it seems that people order a lot with the order of which one is to be grilled, the wait is a bit long. If you go hungry, you will cry :))

name: Skewers
address: 9A Thai Van Lung Street, District 1 9A ThaÃÅi VƒÉn Lung, Q.1, Ho Chi Minh City Vietnam
description: Located near the Opera House, Caravelle and The Park Hyatt Hotel (5 minutes walk). Skewers has been open since July of 2000. The restaurant has 2 level, ground floor with 30+ seating, bar area and open kitchen. 1st floor with 12 tables, plus a cigar/smoking lounge. Skewers is open for lunch and dinner only. From 11:30 to 2pm and 6pm to 11pm. The kitchen last order is at 10:30pm. The restaurant is good for groups, wine tasting, lunch, special dinner, entertaining clients, romance, delivery and reservation.
example_reviews: This is a favourite restaurant in HCMC, conveniently located in District 1. Skewers serves excellent Mediterranean food-I had Greek sausages-in a pleasant ambiance with very courteous waiting staff. And it won't set you back huge amounts wither. Recommended.

Having had a few days of Vietnamese food, it was good to have a different type of meal. Had a dip with lots of different breads to share. Had a main course each,one of which is the seafood pasta under chefs recommended. All very delicious. Service was good and quick. Closes at 22.00 and we were advised 15 minutes early that it was time for last orders. Lots of places within a few minutes walking distance to have a drink afterwards

Love this place. This was my third time visiting. The wine is very cheap and I love the greek sausage and marinara sauce over the mashed potatoes and peas. I think I've ordered the same thing everytime I've visited. I'd try more of the menu but I just love the way they do that dish way too much. Great food.

name: Cocotte
address: 136/11 Le Thanh Ton, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Near Ben Thanh market, the heart of Ho Chi Minh, Discover Traditional Authentic French Cuisine for everyone, with great value, warm and friendly professional service. Indulge in our carefully selected wine selection. Cocotte is the address of French Bistro food and wines in Ho Chi Minh City.
example_reviews: Delicious lunch & good French wine for a nice priceüëåüèº We went back for top dinner, the best we had in Vietnam in 3 weeks. French master chef level. Very friendly staff, who do their utmost to offer you great service. Strongly recommended. Great value for money. Must-do-in-Saigon

We had a great time with a really festive athmosphere that made us feel like in a Parisian bistro. The duck magret with pepper sauce, the oignon soup and the Bread were all delicious. The price was very reasonable with a bill of just 50‚Ç¨ for 3 of us including a bottle of delicious Bordeauw wine. We highly recomend and will go again!

Great French food at a reasonable price. Good selection of wine and the house wine, red or white, are as good as any in Saigon. The seafood stew is a must and ask for baguettes on the side to slurp up the sauce. Delicious

name: The Daun Restaurant
address: 48 Le Lai Ben Thanh Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: With the favourites Vietnam/Malaysia/Singapore/Indonesia local dishes such as the Pho Bo, Bun Bo, Banh Xeo, Banh mi, Mee Nasi Goreng Seafood, Nasi Ayam Penyet and much more; you‚Äôll definitely be spoilt for choices. The Malaysians & Singaporeans along with their other close counterparts such as Korean & Japanese would appreciate the pleasing sense to the taste and most likely they cannot forbear to close on the reminiscent experience. We also serve some European cuisines.
example_reviews: The only best halal food in HCMC. The quality of food served is excellent and delicious and prepared with care. The owner is a dedicated man who obviously cares greatly for his business, his food and above all his customers. Halal food a novelty in HCMC and therefore the prices are higher understandably. However, having eaten at other neighboring restaurants, none satisfied me with the quality of their food as Daun did. Other restaurants were noisy, cluttered and served seriously bland food. I think what has happened is that since halal food in HCMC is rare, other outlets don't care about quality as much since the Muslim customers will be forced to go to these restaurants. Daun, on the other hand, is still dedicated to serving great food. For that I am truly grateful. Don't take my word for it. Feel free to compare yourselves.

This halal & veg-friendly outlet is a delightful findüíï The menu is pretty extensive from Japanese to Western and South East Asian. We chose some healthy options - beef broth, French beans+egg, mushroom omelette & tumeric prawn (not on menu but a request that was graciously met). Mr Soffian, the owner, has a genuinely friendly personality with a passion for good service and great food. Wonderful hospitality! We got to try his egg coffee - a yummy concoction that seems like a dessert in a cup! If you‚Äôre after good friendly service and yummy food with something on the menu for a diverse group, you can‚Äôt go wrong with this eatery. Vert strongly recommended.

Located in the heart of Ho Chi Minh City, Dau Restaurant offers a delightful blend of traditional Vietnamese cuisine and modern flair. The ambiance is warm and inviting, with a mix of rustic decor and contemporary touches that create a cozy yet stylish dining experience. The menu features a variety of dishes, but the standout for me was the pho, which was rich in flavor with perfectly tender beef. The fresh herbs and spices added a wonderful depth that truly showcased the essence of Vietnamese cooking. I also tried their summer rolls, which were light and refreshing, with a delightful peanut dipping sauce.

name: Ciao Bella District 1
address: 11 Dong Du Street District 1, Ho Chi Minh City Vietnam Vietnam
description: New York Italian. Warm casual eatery
example_reviews: Best Italian Food in Ho Chi Minh City I visited 4 times. The quality and freshness is incredible and so is the service. Freshly grated pepper and Parmesan cheese, a free welcome sparkling and hands down best spaghetti puntanesca and Cesar salad. A must visit if you look for a real Italian Restauanrany and atmosphere

Ciao Bella in District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, offers a cozy Italian dining experience with warm service and delicious dishes. Highlights include complimentary prosecco and the signature Posh Carbonara prepared tableside. A great spot for a hearty Italian meal, though it can get busy during peak hours.

We needed a non Vietnam meal. Fabulous. Starts with glass of Prosecco, then they bing bread with 3 small samples of black olive puree, and dipping balsamic, and roasted garlic before you order. We had the beet salad(fabulous) spaghetti and meatballs, spinach and ricotta ravioli with house wines

name: Moo Beef Steak - 109 Ly Tu Trong
address: 109 L√Ω T·ª± Tr·ªçng Ben Thanh Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description:
Highly recommend. A nice treat for when in HCMC.
Great service, food, wine and setting.
A lot more than what you would price but it's really worth it as a one off treat when on holiday.
Highly recommended going on Mondays for the 50% off selected steaks to make it even more value for money.
example_reviews: Highly recommend. A nice treat for when in HCMC. Great service, food, wine and setting. A lot more than what you would price but it's really worth it as a one off treat when on holiday. Highly recommended going on Mondays for the 50% off selected steaks to make it even more value for money.

Every ingredient in our meal was of a high standard and prepared with great skilk. The steaks were succulent and cooked just to the right standard. The same could also be said for the fresh and delicious mussels as well as the mushrooms, asparagus, and chips. The wine menu was also excellent as was the care given to presentation and pouring. I also enjoyed the decor and the music created an intimate atmosphere that allowed our family to enjoy our time together without being intruded upon or intruding on others. My was an excellent waitress, ever solicitous of our enjoyment and comfort.

Monday night is 50% off night and just as well as prices on the menu don‚Äôt include VAT or Service charge. Monday night is quite busy. The restaurant has a great ambiance. You get a great pate aperitif with lovely hot bread rolls. The beef is really good quality and tasty. We had one strip loin (a bit of fat rind but really good) and a tenderloin (like fillet, no fat). Cooked medium rare perfect. The wines are very expensive so went for the beer option. The water was the most expensive in Vietnam 140,000 plus tax plus service! It came from France‚Ä¶ no idea why! So it came out as the most expensive meal so far in Vietnam - in spite of the 50% discount. But great meal, good quality and service.

name: B·∫øp Cu·ªën S√†i G√≤n
address: 76 V√µ VƒÉn T·∫ßn, Ph∆∞·ªùng V√µ Th·ªã S√°u, Qu·∫≠n 3, Ho Chi Minh City 70000 Vietnam
description: A Truely Vietnamese Experience!!! Bep Cuon Sai Gon is the 2nd branch of Bep Cuon Team. With the success of Bep Cuon Danang since Sep 2019, our team have decided to open the new restaurant in Ho Chi Minh City in Apr 2023 in hope of bringing the authentic Vietnamese cuisines to everyone living in Ho Chi Minh and travelers as well. Customers' satisfaction is our top priority, therefore, we always concentrate on food hygiene, cleanliness, food consistency and customer service. We do hope to have chance to welcome you all to our new Bep Cuon in Saigon.
example_reviews: We enjoyed shrimp and braised pork spring rolls and the Bep Cuon Combo 2. The food was fabulous and was more than enough for the two of us to share. The staff was so very friendly and showed us how to assemble our lunch with rice paper, lettuce, mint, basil, kimchi and the pork/shrimp pancake. The sauce (a mixture of the two provided...also demonstrated by one of our lovely servers) to dip in was so delicious I wanted to drink up the remains! I highly recommend this restaurant.

Went by by by chance and were really pleasantly surprised. Fantastic food. Many authentic Vietnamese dishes to choose from. We chose a combo. Pork, rice, boiled cabbage, fish soup and some other things that I do not know the name of. Not spicy, but oh what flavors. A little noisy environment if you want to be a little fussy, but very good speed of serving. Can really be recommended and here we will gladly come again.

Had a great experience at Bep Cuon Saigon! The crunchy banh xeo was absolutely delicious‚Äîlight, crispy, and packed with flavor. The pork skewers were a highlight, too, perfectly seasoned and grilled just right. Fresh ingredients and great flavors make this spot worth a visit if you‚Äôre in Saigon and craving authentic, tasty bites.

name: Tandoor
address: 39A-39B Ng√¥ ƒê·ª©c K·∫ø, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Tandoor Indian Restaurants has been serving the best Indian food in Ho Chi Minh City since 1997. Our first restaurant is located on 39A Ngo Duc Ke street, at the intersection with the Nguyen Hue Walking street, and next to the famed Dong Khoi street. Witness the pinnacle of Indian cuisine through our experienced team composed of dedicated Indian veterans. Beyond our charming two venues in the heart of historical Saigon, we also offer Indian food delivery and catering. We persevere to serve delicious non-vegetarian, vegetarian, vegan, and halal Indian food to guests of all origins. At Tandoor Saigon, the freshest authentic spices are ground in-house and combined with quality local produce for the ultimate Indian dining experience.
example_reviews: We have been coming to Tandoor for two years now and it does not fail to please. The dishes are perfectly spiced to the level that you ask for, presentation is always excellent and the portions are spot on. Service from the staff is always excellent and you are served with a smile. The restaurant itself is very pleasing and clean. This is a very popular Indian restaurant for a reason and has a well deserved reputation for being managed to a very high standard.

I found this Indian really nice, good service, great food and the staff were really efficient and helpful. I will definitely be going again in the next 6 weeks. I would recommend it to anyone who enjoys Indian food.

Found this by mistake we were looking for a steak restaurant but found they weren‚Äôt what we were looking for, so wondering around we‚Äôd seen the steak restaurant upstairs opposite but couldn‚Äôt find our way in (yes we‚Äôre slack sometimes) found this so decided on a curry instead with it being our last night, very pleasant restaurant and staff were lovely. Ordered a couple of beers to be going on with them our starters !! 1 starters each big mistake portion sizes are quite large, wife had the chicken tikka, I had onion pakora both were lovely and the touch of putting you first piece on your plate was quite nice, pakora were spicy and really nice best I‚Äôve had for a while, tikka were lovely big pieces and so succulent. Then we had mains wife had keema mutta (probably spelt wrong) she said it was best she‚Äôs ever had just enough spice for her, I had chicken vindaloo, loads of chicken (loads of curry if I‚Äôm honest) not quite spicy enough for me usually have them a little hotter but very nice all the same. Portion sizes were quite large neither of us could finish our dishes ! I‚Äôd had a garlic naan wife had 2 chapatis not really nice, if we‚Äôre ever in HCMC again we shall definitely be back

name: Saigon Caf√© - Seafood Buffet Restaurant
address: 88 ƒê√¥ng Du, Ph∆∞·ªùng B·∫øn Ngh√©, Qu·∫≠n 1 Sheraton Saigon Grand Opera Hotel, Ho Chi Minh City 70000 Vietnam
description: From the Opera House, walk along Dong Khoi street and you will easily recognize Saigon Caf√© restaurant from its floor-to-ceiling glasses, luxury ambiance, modern finishing‚Äôs and vibrant energy. Situated on level 1 of the Sheraton Saigon Grand Opera Hotel overlooking Dong Khoi street, Saigon Caf√© is one of the best buffet destinations in Saigon since 2003. Offering a vast selection of live cooking and interactive counters, each features an array of theater showcasing an array of hand-crafted dishes ranging from regional cuisines of Vietnam to Chinese, Japanese, Italian, French, Indian and more. From sunrise to sunset, our chefs, premium ingredients and excellent service quality will undoubtedly delight your taste buds for an unparalleled dining experience.
review_summary:
Saigon Caf√© - Seafood Buffet Restaurant earns rave reviews for its exceptional service, with guests frequently commending the attentive and friendly staff. Nestled in the heart of the city, the restaurant's prime location and cozy atmosphere are popular among reviewers, creating a welcoming dining experience.

The buffet's selection of fresh, diverse seafood and international cuisine receives consistent praise for both variety and quality, contributing to the establishment's reputation for great value.
example_reviews: Visited this restaurant which is located within the Sheraton hotel 2wks ago to celebrate my sister‚Äôs birthday & we opted for the full experience with free flowing champagne- well worth the money. The restaurant had a wide diverse of dishes, all freshly prepared.- the lobster‚Äôs & fresh seafood were fantastic. The staff were wonderful & explained dishes that we ventured to try. They even surprised us with a birthday cake for my sister & the staff sang happy birthday to her- really nice gesture. There are other buffets in Saigon, but the review on the Saigon Cafe from YouTube- Tim Lee, attracted us the most & we were not disappointed. This is a wonderful experience not to be missed. Thank you Saigon Cafe for making our evening with you memorable- will definitely recommend this to everyone.

Wow, what an amazing service at Saigon Cafe. Ho√†ng and Huy were our waiters. They did a maverous job in their services, very attentive and hard working. Hoang recommended coconuts iced coffee. It‚Äôs the bomb! I love it.

Step into a vibrant culinary feast, where a wide range of flavours await you. Our sumptuous buffet brings together global delights - juicy grilled meats, fresh seafood, crisp salads and handmade cheeses to be enjoyed by all. Pasta made to order, fine sushi rolls and fresh-cut, quality meat chops are just as compelling. Don't forget to leave some room for dessert: everything from rich chocolate fountains to fine French pastries. Elegant and relaxing environment, perfect for family gatherings, business luncheons or weekend dinners. Fresh ingredients, attentive service and on-site cooking stations are carefully selected to ensure every visit is worth a taste. Whether you love home-cooked flavours or exotic treasures, our buffet feast will kick off an unforgettable taste bud journey for every diner. Dat & Quan & Huy they are the best!

name: P'ti Saigon
address: 52 Ng√¥ Quang Huy Ph∆∞·ªùng Th·∫£o ƒêi·ªÅn, Qu·∫≠n 2, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Coming to P‚Äôti Saigon, diners will be immersed in the culinary culture of Provence, the homeland of lavender in the south of France created by the hands of talented French chef Sakal Phoeung ‚Äì who has been with the Accord Group and the Sofitel brand for more than 15 years, has had great success with the French restaurant Le Corto where it was honoured to welcome the French President Fran√ßois Hollande. The restaurant has designed a large, spacious kitchen with full equipment so that he and his students can prepare menus with culinary culture with stories. Beautiful, delicious and fine quality for health look forward to sending to customers who come to P‚ÄôTI Saigon.
example_reviews: A French restaurant where a luxurious and cozy space creates a sense of comfort for guests. French cuisine is very delicate and beautiful, offering a rich and varied taste. However, the prices at this restaurant are a little higher compared to the quality of the food. However, Bang's service staff is very friendly and attentive and always ready to meet your needs.

We come here so many timea for brunch and every time we always ask brunch with freeflow package. We like it very much cauz we have 3hrs drink unlimited wine and prosecco...with tempting price. And staffs here all remember our names, ms Bang, ms Ha and ms Mo always always address me by name. Appriciated

I have used breakfast this morning and i very impressed about the food. French food is not my kind on but today is different. Thank to the waiter Bang, he recommended for me many delicious dishes when i say i don‚Äôt like french cuisine. His attitude very good

name: Quan Nem Restaurant
address: 15E Nguyen Thi Minh Khai street, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City 70000 Vietnam
description:
I went there by a recommendation with a friend who lived in HCMC as an expat. The place was packed during peaked hours so we made a booking in advance.

We ordered buncha with southern sauce and mixed of normal pork and bacon to try. Buncha was amazing, and gimmick of grilling pork and bacon added a nice touch to it. The vegetable side, typical in Vietnam, was huge and plenty. The sauce was yummy.

The crab roll is super big and tasty. It was served hot. I also tried their soda chan, soda with sugar and lime - was very refreshing.

We managed to get through this with limited English because the menu contained only buncha and rolls, not difficult to navigate. One of the best meal I have had in HCMC.
example_reviews: I went there by a recommendation with a friend who lived in HCMC as an expat. The place was packed during peaked hours so we made a booking in advance. We ordered buncha with southern sauce and mixed of normal pork and bacon to try. Buncha was amazing, and gimmick of grilling pork and bacon added a nice touch to it. The vegetable side, typical in Vietnam, was huge and plenty. The sauce was yummy. The crab roll is super big and tasty. It was served hot. I also tried their soda chan, soda with sugar and lime - was very refreshing. We managed to get through this with limited English because the menu contained only buncha and rolls, not difficult to navigate. One of the best meal I have had in HCMC.

The B√∫n Ch·∫£ tastes good. It is served with soft white vermicelli, mint leaves and other greens, two different fish sauces, and grilled marinated pork patties and bacon strips. What I love most is the Nem Cua B·ªÉ, crispy rolls with pork and crab meat. These are served on a griddle and go well with the B√∫n Ch·∫£. The only downside of this place is the tiny size of the restaurant. It can get rather uncomfortable when it is full of patrons. But I would recommend anyone who visits Ho Chi Minh City and would love to taste good Vietnamese food.

This place is always packed with people, so don't be surprised if you have to wait a bit for a table. But the turnover is fast, so waiting time is rarely more than 15 minutes. The restaurant's specialty is fried crab spring rolls and that's pretty much all the restaurant serves other than grilled pork. The spring rolls are fantastic. I make a point to eat them at Quan Nem anytime I'm in Saigon (I went twice in three days during recent visit)!

name: Italiani's Pizza
address: 17 Han Thuyen, Ho Chi Minh City Vietnam
description: Italiani‚Äôs specializes in beautifully crafted individual wood fired pizzas and Italian-inspired dishes. We poured our hearts into creating a local Pizzeria that provides exceptional food, a welcoming environment for families and business professionals, and a fun date night spot for couples. We use the most flavorful tomatoes, cheeses and other fresh locally-sourced ingredients when possible to make our wood fired pizzas and Italian-inspired dishes. Our pizza dough is also made with ‚Äúsecret‚Äù ingredients that are hand worked and tossed to ensure that our pizzas have a deliciously thin crispy crust, with a chewy center, topped with the freshest ingredients. They are then fired to perfection in our authentic wood fired oven to seal in flavor and transform our menu items into fine crafted masterpieces. Our appetizers, salads, homemade gelato, and local craft beers are just a few more reasons to enjoy a meal at Italiani‚Äôs Homemade Pizza.
review_summary:
Italiani's Pizza comes highly recommended by many guests who extol the virtues of its friendly and attentive staff. While the atmosphere receives mixed reviews‚Äîsome patrons describe it as cozy, others find it lacking‚Äîthe authentic, wood-fired pizzas consistently earn rave reviews for their flavorful crusts and varied toppings.

Although a few visitors mention that prices can be steep, the majority agree that the delicious offerings provide good value.
example_reviews: Italiani's Pizza Han Thuyen - The children fancied pizza after all the pho they had eaten. From the moment we entered, the customer service was impeccable. Tracy the staff went above and beyond not just with the service but also when we asked about where to get mangosteen she researched where we could get some as the season for this fruit was over. After the children devoured the pizza we had to order another as it was so delicious! After leaving to go to the recommended spot for mangosteen, we realised we forgot our backpack and the manager/owner went out of his way to drop the bag to us! How kind! The staff are so lovely here and food is of high quality so if you ever fancy a pizza definitely would recommend this establishment! This will be somewhere we will definitely return to eat!

We ordered salad, pasta, and pizza, and everything tasted amazing. Highly recommend the pesto pasta with chicken. Our server Rambo was always attentive and help us through out our ordering with excellent recommendations! He even suggested some nice places to visit during the night.

Accommodating staff and tasty pizza. be mindful it‚Äôs a little pricier than the usual Vietnamese dinner prices. We paid 1,400000 VND for 4 pizzas and drinks for 3 adults and 3 kids. Air conditioning is worked well.

name: Rice Field
address: 75 - 77 Ho Tung Mau Level 2, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Located on 1 of the busiest streets in Saigon, Rice Field is like a gem brings you a touch of VN countryside by the authentic Vietnamese food and decoration
example_reviews: Wandering around bustling Ho Chi Minh City in search of a Vietnamese restaurant for dinner, we were intrigued by Rice Field , which is located right at the foot of the Bitexo Financial Tower on the opposite side , hard not to find! Original location all in wood with original Vietnamese details , we had dinner on the ground floor , very young waiters in traditional clothes quick and gentle , menu 'extensive at inline prices being recommended on the Michelin Guide . We ordered more dishes, almost all vegetarian, fantastic fried rolls, other fresh rolls of mixed vegetables, saut√©ed noodles with tofu and vegetables and fried calamari with vegetables, all great, well presented and hearty dishes, sauces and chilli served separately, however they ask for the degree of spiciness you want. Great idea to bring lettuce to wrap the fried rolls and not get your hands dirty! Really one of the best restaurants we stayed in our three weeks in Vietnam. Recommended! Only note, I would recommend more care in cleaning tables and in the bathroom.

Delicious, lots of it. Good service. Central location but reasonable price with mid-range income, 2 people eat about 500k to be full. You should replace the chopsticks with new ones, the current chopsticks are moldy, reducing the customer experience

I had the pleasure of dining at this restaurant and I must say it was a truly exceptional dining experience. From the beginning, the welcoming and relaxing atmosphere made me feel at ease straight away. The dish that struck my palate the most was the fried calamari, crunchy and tasty, with a touch of freshness that made every bite a real pleasure. The fried garlic rice was equally delicious, packed with flavor and perfectly prepared. I can't help but mention the Michelin rice cake, which was truly a pleasant surprise: soft and tasty, demonstrating the chef's culinary skill. The service was impeccable, with friendly staff attentive to our needs. The background music helped create a pleasant atmosphere, without ever being intrusive. I highly recommend this restaurant to all lovers of good food and an authentic dining experience. If you're looking for delicious flavors and a welcoming environment, you can't go wrong with this place! I will definitely be back to try other delicacies on the menu. Five stars deserved!

name: Pizza 4P's Le Thanh Ton
address: 8/15, ƒê. L√™ Th√°nh T√¥n Ph∆∞·ªùng B·∫øn Ngh√©, Qu·∫≠n 1, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: An Earth to People restaurant on a mission to make the world smile for peace, one pizza at a time. Earth to People is our commitment to serve safe and fresh foods directly from Mother Earth to you. Located in Ho Chi Minh City, Hanoi, Danang, Haiphong and Nha Trang.
example_reviews: We checked the menu online and picked a location close to our hotel, and cancelled our original choice of a rooftop restaurant or bar, for our last night in Vietnam. The outlet we visited was packed to the gills and we then moved to this one. Despite being very very crowded with a one hour waiting, the staff at the earlier outlet were exceptionally helpful and courteous. Once we got to our new location, from the very beginning the staff was helpful in accommodating our booking change from 2 guests to 4 and gave us a table as soon as they could and tried to ensure we got seats whilst waiting. Every drink / dish we ordered turned out to be exceptional. The servers were very perceptive and understood our requirements and ensured that they clarified about allergens, and to the extent of limitations we may have about other ingredients. It shows the training and culture of the Brand. They also took pains to clarify that some dishes would not suit us or apologise for being sold out! The (very common) Mojito, or the Sangrias or even the Whey cider were exceptional to say the least. The cheese platters with the toasted breads, the pizza, the desserts (esp the terrine) were fantastic Personally, I found it refreshing and surprising that a chain with outlets across countries and cities, was able to rise above mass production and yet retain flavour, presentation as also service. Highly recommend this to all visitors to Vietnam (and elsewhere), and especially to vegetarians / vegans for the choices.

This establishment offers exceptional value for your money, providing not only affordable prices but also delivering high-quality and satisfying meals. The service is not only efficient but also friendly, creating a welcoming atmosphere that enhances the overall dining experience. With such a positive experience, I can confidently say that I will eagerly return to enjoy the delicious food and hospitality once again.

PIZZA 4P‚ÄôS, a real hidden gem located in district 1 in ‚Äòmini Japan town‚Äô. We were completely blown away by the fresh ingredients that you could clearly taste/sense were fresh! Organic, sustainable, local + homemade cheese, reasonable prices for the quality and sweet/proffesional staff, just a very good experience. Don‚Äôt be fooled by the name, there‚Äôs much more than just pizza on the menu.

name: Pasteur Street Craft Beer - Original Taproom
address: 144/3 Pasteur, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Our Original Taproom! This is where it all started in 2015. This small and cozy Taproom is known by many and was one of the first places where you could get your craft beer in Saigon. We have expanded with more seats and a rooftop further down the alley on the right side which opens daily 11am ‚Äì 12am,
review_summary:
The Pasteur Street Craft Beer - Original Taproom garners praise for its inviting atmosphere and the accompaniment of good music, as noted by patrons who appreciate the venue's cool vibe. Guests have called out the Western-style food options for their tastiness and generous portions, emphasizing the overall delicious and diverse menu offerings. While the craft beers are described as refreshing, they are also sometimes considered to be on the pricier side.

However, the overall value is regarded as favorable due to the food's affordability. The establishment's service earns rave reviews for the staff's remarkable friendliness and attentiveness, contributing to a truly welcoming experience.
example_reviews: Great food at a good price was very happy with what we received. Wife had the Crab omelet with garlic fried rice and I had the 2 sausages with onion rings and oyster mushrooms as a side. 10/10 reminded me of good pub food from home.

I really enjoyed this place. I am a lightweight and I am always looking for a beer with less alcohol and have the ability to order in a small glass instead of a pint or something huge and this place hit all of the dots. It also had probably the best tasting, very low alcohol beer I have ever had - chanh muoi ale (salted lime). Thinking about this place too much and will go back when I am in Saigon again! :)

I did not expect to find ‚Äòreal‚Äô craft beer in Vietnam. I am so pleasantly surprised. I got a flight; I had the Irish Stout, Jasmine Red, Session IPA, Pomello IPA, Double Jasmine IPA, and the special Stout (I forget the exact name; it‚Äôs an extra charge) It was super delicious! Cherry and chocolate notes. Yum! I had the Pasteur Street hamburger which comes with fries. It was delicious. My wife had the Omelette with crab and rice and it was delicious as well. It was also delicious. We had the fried ground duck with rice crackers and the onion rings for an appetizer. I recommend both. The service was impeccabile. Our waiter was very friendly and helped us order food. Everything is in English so there was no problem ordering. My wife does not like spicy foods, so the waiter made sure nothing was spicy, and brought me some Tabasco to spice up my food. I HIGHLY recommend eating here if you‚Äôre in the area. There is a bit of variety in the menu, so you‚Äôre not limited to one or two choices. Again, if you like craft beer definitely stop by here ‚Ä¶ and take a flight!

name: Hoang's Kitchen - Vietnamese Cuisine & Vegan Food
address: 45 Th·ªß Khoa Hu√¢n Ph∆∞·ªùng B·∫øn Th√†nh, Qu·∫≠n 1, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Welcome to Hoang‚Äôs Kitchen, where the rich flavors of Vietnamese cuisine blend seamlessly with the timeless beauty of Southeast Asian-inspired architecture. Located in the heart of Ho Chi Minh City, our restaurant is a haven for both locals and international visitors seeking an authentic dining experience. Welcome to Hoang‚Äôs Kitchen, where the rich flavors of Vietnamese cuisine blend seamlessly with the timeless beauty of Southeast Asian-inspired architecture.
example_reviews: Vivi was amazing and looked after us so well! We stopped in for lunch and had the vegan beef stir-fry and the vegan pho and they were absolutely delicious and very well priced. We had a cold beer too. Thank you so much Vivi for all of your help and the great food recommendations!

Very tasty food: we had a couple of salads for lunch ‚Äì banana flour and shrimp with roasted peanuts and a similar salad with green mangoes, accompanied by fruit juices (passion and mango) plus to finish Vietnamese iced coffee (coconut) and ginger tea. Service was speedy. Our server Ryan was so helpful, responsive and friendly. His English is excellent. Background music is pop, while we were there Vietnamese in a western style but we were told that sometimes it is western music and musicians.

I stumbled upon Hoang‚Äôs Kitchen and it turned out to be one of my favorite food spots in the city! I ordered the fresh rolls and the incredibly soft grilled pork with quail eggs ‚Äî both recommended by Bear, one of the friendliest and most helpful staff I‚Äôve met on my trip. The flavors were bold, fresh, and perfectly balanced. The grilled pork was melt-in-your-mouth tender, and paired with the quail eggs, it hit all the right notes. Bear really went above and beyond to make sure I had the best experience ‚Äî from helping with the order to making great suggestions. It‚Äôs the kind of place that feels warm, local, and authentic. Highly recommend if you‚Äôre in Saigon and craving something genuinely good and comforting!

name: Vo Roof
address: 113 Ton That Dam Street Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Welcome to Vo Roof - Modern Vietnamese Kitchen & Bar! We take great pride in offering you a delightful dining experience with our healthy Vietnamese cuisine. Our dishes are cooked in a modern Vietnamese kitchen, using family recipes that have been passed down for three generations. Our food is free from MSG, and instead, focus on using fresh ingredients and moderate seasoning to bring forth the authentic flavors of Vietnam. At Vo Roof, our commitment to providing a memorable dining experience goes beyond just the food. We also feature a cozy and chilling tropical-inspired ambiance, where you can relax and unwind with your loved ones. To complement your dining experience, we offer a selection of classic cocktails prepared with utmost care and artistry. Visit us and embark on a culinary journey that combines tradition and innovation, all wrapped up in a warm and inviting atmosphere.
example_reviews: First time in Ho Chi Minh and wanted somewhere relaxed to eat. Vo Roof is an absolute must if you want some genuinely tasty food (chicken skewers and dry noodle bowls are awesome), and really good prices. Staff are lovely and super friendly, young, fun and helpful. Please do visit as sure you will be delighted. Oh, and book as only small and reserved signs on table, use Facebook.

I had lunch with friends in this restaurant. Recommendation if you want to dine here to book or arrive early because it is always very full and in fact we the evening of the day before we could not sit down. The next day we ate at the counter and had a great time: dishes with good tastes (meat sandwich, fried chicken with vegetables...) and low prices in the average Saigon prices. Super recommended!

From start to finish, Vo Roof, exceeded all expectations, and provided a superlative dining experience in a relaxed and inviting environment. From the moment we entered, the friendly and attentive staff made us feel incredibly welcome. Upon being seated we were served a refreshing starter of cool juice along with wet towelettes to freshen up and clear the dust from our journey through the busy Saigon streets. The menu was extensive and the prices were surprisingly low compared to other restaurants in District 1. Our dishes were served quickly and the food was excellent. My wife and I were discussing whether we could possibly make room for a light dessert when to our delighted surprise our waiter appeared with two small dishes of delicious cubed fruit which was provided free of charge as if they had read our minds. A perfect finish to a wonderful evening out. We will absolutely be returning to enjoy more of the wonderful food, superb, friendly service, and joyful atmosphere provided. Do yourself a favour and track down this hidden gem on your next visit to Saigon.

name: La Fiesta
address: 128 Ly Tu Trong Ben Thanh Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Hola Amigos! This is OUR Tex-Mexican Restaurant in HCMC, Vietnam. I'm (Scott) from Maine, USA & my wife and better half (Duc) is from here in Saigon. What we are trying to do here at La Fiesta is to make some tasty and fairly authentic Tex-Mexican food, served with a smile in a welcoming setting. We make all of our sauces and tortillas onsite, and also use Saigon Tacos locally made Corn Tortillas & Salsa Verde. We take great pride in our work, and strive to do our best to pay attention to detail every single day. It's the little things that count, and that gets lost sometimes. We will all work hard every day to stay on top of our game, and keep you wanting to come back to La Fiesta. Serving tasty Tex-Mex food and drink in the heart of Saigon.
example_reviews: The food is AMAZING. So many choices of Mexican, western, salads and different sides. The portions they give you are very generous and the staff are so lovely. One of the best restaurants we‚Äôve been to in vietnam. They also give you some free crisps/dips at the start of your meal and a free shot at the end of the meal!

The first time I went to La Fiesta I didn't really do the food justice as I was on a diet and so only ate the chicken salad. But the salad was refreshing and the dressing was enjoyable. The chicken was very more-ish too. And the frozen jalapeno Margarita was one of the best, most enjoyable Margaritas tasted anywhere. The next two times I had a delivery of chili con carne which came with french fries, so I made my own basmati rice to go with the chili as rice is my preference and also enjoyed the shoestring fries. I had a side of salad too which was just as fresh and tasty as I remembered. The chili con carne was too much on the mild side for me, although still a delicious flavour, but a couple of sliced red chilis added to the chili soon remedied that and brought it up to the level of spiciness I'm used to. The whole experience was very satisfying and I.m now looking forward to trying many of the other dishes at La Fiesta as well.

I had burrito plate which included taco salad that was tasty and fresh, tofu burrito which was tasty and two sides including refried beans that were really good, rice that was bland, and for dessert a brownie that was very fresh. I had fresh watermelon juice and it tasted like it was just made. It was 2pm and there were 2 other tables, and lots of Grab delivery guys picking up. Servers are so nice and attentive.

name: Tonkin Coffee
address: 91 Ly Tu Trong Follow the red slit and go upstairs to the 2nd floor, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Ho Chi Minh's coffee haven. Tonkin Specialty Coffee: Rich Vietnamese brews, colonial charm & garden escapes. Immerse your senses. Tonkin Specialty Coffee: 91 Ly Tu Trong, Ben Thanh ward, District 1 https://maps.app.goo.gl/fEY7STPwVrZCwkVg8 Tonkin Garden: 135/50 Tran Hung Dao, Cau Ong Lanh ward, District 1 https://maps.app.goo.gl/aQG9XsYygEoQ5CxdA
example_reviews: This is a lovely relaxed coffee shop that sits above the hustle and bustle of district 1. The cafe is very atmospheric with comfortable indoor seating or section of bar seating on the balcony. Of the coffee options there were clear vegan options (oat milk/coconut). While obviously a little more expensive than more local places, this is still reasonably priced at less than ¬£2 for a coconut coffee with coconut flakes and a complimentary cold tea on arrival. The cafe is above a restaurant, there is a sign for it, and to the left of the sign is a doorway leading to a corridor, at the end of this corridor you go up the steps to level 2. The steps are a decent size and have railing so suitable for anyone who can climb stairs mobility wise.

In April 2024 I visited Vietnam with my son. While we were there, like so many other tourists and locals alike, we both fell in love with Vietnamese coffee and sought out various coffee shops across the country to try their version of the national drink. Tonkin Coffee in HCMC offered some of the absolute best coffee we had during our 3-week stay in Vietnam. We tried out their milk and egg coffees ‚Äì both were delicious, so much so that we ordered a second coffee while we were there. As we were also hungry when we got to the coffee shop, we had some of their pastries and banh mi. Both were excellent! I should also mention the outstanding friendly service at the caf√© as well. This literal hole in the wall caf√© is located down a long alley hallway and up a flight of stairs, but it is well worth seeking out. I highly recommend this wonderful little coffee shop!

A true hidden gem in Saigon! We nearly walked past it as the entrance is just a doorway, but we‚Äôre glad we found it! We both had the Tonkin version of a Vietnamese coffee (mine was iced, my husband went for hot). We also had a custard-filled croissant each which were absolutely lovely! The atmosphere was calm and the staff lovely. Get yourself in!

name: Mrsimple Steakhouse
address: 62 Truong Quyen Ward Vo Thi Sau , District 3, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description:
To enjoy the ultimate French dining experience in Saigon, look no further than @mrsimple.steakhouse. Even though I have been to HCMC several times, but this is the 1st time we patronized a fine-dining. Located away from tourist areas and near popular pink fa√ßade T√¢n ƒê·ªãnh Catholic Church, it gives out a calm and relaxing vibe. 

With crystal chandeliers hanging over high ceiling and French paintings and d√©cor, it make a posh fine dining restaurant, to celebrate special occasions. We go for their most expensive set for 2, which consists of starters, salad, soups, main course and desserts. 

Using quality ingredients and fine to attention details, every dishes was presented exquisitely, with nice blend of flavour and savoury, fresh and sweet in taste. Steak was cooked using sous vide technique, ensuring that it was tender and juicy, best to pair with a glass of red wine to elevate the flavour. 

Price was surprisingly reasonable, given the ambience and quality of food served. We were definitely be back when we visit Saigon again!!
example_reviews: To enjoy the ultimate French dining experience in Saigon, look no further than @mrsimple.steakhouse. Even though I have been to HCMC several times, but this is the 1st time we patronized a fine-dining. Located away from tourist areas and near popular pink fa√ßade T√¢n ƒê·ªãnh Catholic Church, it gives out a calm and relaxing vibe. With crystal chandeliers hanging over high ceiling and French paintings and d√©cor, it make a posh fine dining restaurant, to celebrate special occasions. We go for their most expensive set for 2, which consists of starters, salad, soups, main course and desserts. Using quality ingredients and fine to attention details, every dishes was presented exquisitely, with nice blend of flavour and savoury, fresh and sweet in taste. Steak was cooked using sous vide technique, ensuring that it was tender and juicy, best to pair with a glass of red wine to elevate the flavour. Price was surprisingly reasonable, given the ambience and quality of food served. We were definitely be back when we visit Saigon again!!

Tucked away in a smaller alley in Ward 6, District 3 in Ho Chi Minh is this unique restaurant. I had seen online when home in Australia then when in Ho Chi Minh went a few days earlier to make arrangements re: specifics of what I wanted and paid deposit. On arrival all looked as expected. We were given menu immediately and needed to make selections for the night as 4 of the 5 courses had choices ! Easy enough . Had to ask for drinks menu and placed our orders and then courses started to arrive . The cake and happy birthday song came out after the first course. After having our final bite of our 3rd course the assistant waiter had our main course signalling the main waiter to take our current plate away to put main course plate down. We then had to ask as our cocktail was finished could he now get us our bottle of wine we had ordered as would obviously like to enjoy with the main course. Pace seemed very rushed . I had to use google translate to get this message across . This being said food was very nice . Ambience very was lovely . I would definitely recommend for a special occasion. It was also in mine opinion excellent value for money . The waiter was very attentive to all requests when asked and a great picture taker for all different couples , groups celebrating an event that evening Just please don‚Äôt rush the food.

Service was perfection as well as the food We were amazed with the foie gras and the angus beef was cooked at the or its best The fish with its crusted top was very good Desserts are ok but not the restaurant best I would not recommend espresso as it was a simple shot of black coffee and not a real espresso

name: Mayonaka Sushi
description:
A little gift, beautifully crafted.

From today, get a complimentary Salmon Rose sashimi when you book in advance and have a bill from 699,000 VND.

This elegant dish is our chef‚Äôs signature
example_reviews: Phenomenal. Probably the best sushi I have had to date. Fish was fresh and melted in your mouth, wasabi was strong and prices are really cheap. Staff were really accommodating and the whole experience felt authentic.

Thank you very much for giving me the chance to talk about my favourite restaurant. The name of my favourite restaurant is Mayonaka and it‚Äôs situated in the centre place of the city (175 De Tham street , Pham ngu lao ward, District 1. I like the spacious, serene environment, serves and tasty food. It is a two storeyed restaurant 2nd floor is reserved for different parties or special events. The room is large and The restaurant offers several dishes including exotic desserts, sashimi , sushi, ice-creams the food is more than great) The prices are reasonable and the foods are served quickly and discount for regular customers are two other reasons I like it more than other restaurants in Ho Chi Minh city

If you are looking for sushi at the very highest level in Ho Chi Minh City, you cannot avoid this address. The fish is simply extra class and even Wagyu fillet is served to Fine Dining Fans - and all at a price that is more than just reasonable, because in Europe a dinner in a Japanese restaurant of this class would be good and happy to cost three times as much and then probably not nearly as perfect! Just a big praise to the service and the kitchen! However, since the restaurant is not too big, it is definitely worth the Reservation in advance.

name: Cafe Hanoi Moment
address: 62 Nguyen Thai Hoc, Ba Dinh, Ha Noi, Viet Nam, Hanoi 000084 Vietnam
description: Nestled in a beautifully preserved French colonial villa, our caf√© offers a unique blend of history, elegance, and charm. Surrounded by high ceilings, vintage tiled floors, and delicate wooden shutters. The ambiance is warm and inviting, perfect for those who appreciate a touch of nostalgia with their coffee.
example_reviews: I ordered an chocolate cheese foam with milk and a tiramisu. The coffee was rich and flavorful, not too sweet‚Äîjust perfect for my taste. The tiramisu was soft, creamy, and delicious without being too heavy. The staff was friendly, attentive, and always ready to assist customers. Additionally, the caf√© played soft, soothing music, making it an ideal spot for working or unwinding. The prices were reasonable for the quality offered.
Beautiful decor and great coffee, with very friendly service. We were a group of 16 which were easily accommodated in a lovely open space upstairs (with air con!)

name: Villa Des Fleurs
address: 95 Qu√°n Th√°nh, Ba Dinh, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Villa des Fleurs is well located near popular sites in the centre of Hanoi, providing a handy respite from the bustle of the city.The attentiveness and friendly hospitality of the Villa des Fleurs staff are well-known. You receive individualised treatment and are treated like a cherished guest from the moment you arrive, making your stay genuinely unforgettable. Another highlight is the Villa des Fleurs dining experience. Meals are excellent and exquisitely presented as a result of the chef's commitment to using local, fresh ingredients.

You receive individualised treatment and are treated like a cherished guest from the moment you arrive, making your stay genuinely unforgettable. Another highlight is the Villa des Fleurs dining experience. Meals are excellent and exquisitely presented as a result of the chef's commitment to using local, fresh ingredients.

This is a beautifully decorated restaurant with fresh flowers throughout- attentive service and beautifully presented dishes. I had delicious smoked salmon, avocado toast - my friends teased me for choosing non- Vietnamese foood, but it was really delicious!!

"The coffee of this place is simply amazing! The taste is solid and aromatic, with a perfect balance between sweetness and acidity. The environment is cozy, ideal for a moment of relaxation or even to work. The service is friendly and quick, making the experience even better. In addition to coffee, there are delicious options of sweets and salts that perfectly combine with the drink. Prices are fair for the quality offered. If you love good coffee, this place is undoubtedly a great choice!"

name: Aira Sky Bar & Restaurant
address: 38A Tran Phu St AIRA Boutique Hanoi Hotel & Spa, Ba Dinh, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Whether you‚Äôre in the mood for a happy hour cocktail, a late-night nightcap, or a delightful dinner, indulge yourself at AIRA Sky Bar & Lounge, perched on the 10th and 11th floors. This stunning rooftop venue offers unrivaled panoramic views of the city skyline, including the iconic Hanoi Flag Tower and the beautifully illuminated National Assembly Building. Savor a carefully curated menu featuring charcuterie, cold cuts, fresh fruit platters, and a selection of fast-prepared delights alongside authentic Vietnamese cuisine. Let our talented mixologists impress you with exquisitely crafted cocktails or a handpicked collection of fine wines. Sink into plush sofas, cushioned seats, or high chairs as you take in the breathtaking sunset, soak up the city lights, and unwind to the rhythm of the music. This is your moment‚Äîrelax and enjoy it.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Ba Dinh
Fast Food Restaurants in Ba Dinh
Asian Restaurants for Lunch in Ba Dinh
Cafes for Lunch in Ba Dinh
example_reviews: We actually stumbled across this bar because we needed to go toilet. Lol didn't realise it was a hidden gem with sky deck views of the city and fabulous cocktaiks and great music. The service was soo friendly and the staff were a joy. Gave us many tips what to do while we stay in Hanoi. The restaurant served amazing food which was open until 10pm so after our drinks on the sky bar we went to the restaurant to eat. Fabulous üëå we will return ‚ô•Ô∏è

Bunbonambo is a good restaurant. It's a bit pricey, but the service is good and the view is good. The lemon lassi is delicious and everything is good, but you have to ask for water separately. I guess they charge extra for water. I asked for a lot of cilantro, and they gave me a generous amount. I was very satisfied with this.

I feel like the restaurant misses the spotlight due to the excellent bar on the roof.... I am a guest at Aira Hotel and usually I avoid hotel restaurants as they are more then usually pretty average. But tonight due to the unfortunate situation of being hit by a motorcycle crossing the road I decided to try the restaurant, rather than go out and risk being run over again... OMG this restaurant is amazing. The staff are so attentive and really care how you are doing, explaining the best way to enjoy each dish, and offer suggestions throughout the evening. But the food is incredible. I went for a set menu, which comes with three courses and a glass of wine. Each course was bursting with flavour and was a joy to eat. The meal was the perfect size leaving me very satisfied at the end. Perfect time to hit the sky Bar and Lounge and enjoy an Espresso Martini!

name: Co Vietnamese Restaurant & Vegan
address: 21 H√†ng C√¢n, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: A distinctive, well-preserved and comfortable space, high-quality products, authentic cuisine, food and drinks are done flawlessly.
cuisines: Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Cafes for Lunch in Hoan Kiem
review_summary:
Co Vietnamese Restaurant & Vegan is celebrated for offering authentic Vietnamese cuisine that reviewers find both flavorful and fresh. Guests have called out the establishment's reasonable pricing, considering the quality of the meals served.

The service at this restaurant earns rave reviews for its quick, attentive, and knowledgeable staff, contributing to a superior dining experience. Many travelers also find the atmosphere cozy and welcoming, providing a lively yet intimate setting that is perfect for a range of occasions.
example_reviews: Super friendly and cozy restaurant with locals and tourists. The staff is very nice. Zin Zin was the one who served me and he taught me how to eat the Vietnamese pancake. Also had shrimp with coconut and rice yogurt for dessert. All very delicious. There‚Äôs an 8% tax added to the prices and if you pay with card an extra 3%

Very friendly staff, and could speak decent English. Helped me to pick the right amount of food and showed me photos of what I was ordering. The menu was also in English. Delicious food, and fair prices.

We were impressed by the excellent dining experience at this restaurant. We tried the Vietnamese spring rolls, crispy on the outside, bitten down to make a slight crunch, and the filling was very fresh, full of vegetable aromas and meaty, layered taste. The service was also impeccable, the staff were very warm, friendly, always smiling, attentively answered all our questions and made us feel at home. In addition, the restaurant's environment is comfortable and welcoming, with chic and Vietnamese decor, perfect for parties, family dinners or a drink with friends. Enjoying food in such an environment is such an enjoyable experience that we look forward to coming back again!

name: Lighthouse Sky Bar & Restaurant
address: 27 Hang Be Rooftop, La Siesta Premium Hang Be Hotel, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: This ambitiously structured bar (unique to Hanoi and Vietnam for that matter) is styled on a boat which creatively plays to the meaning of Hang Be street. The bar is √¢‚Ç¨Àúmoored√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢ over three levels of terrace space (Rooftop floors); its bow with the bar area overlooks the street while at the back the stern faces the Red River.

example_reviews: We came to the restaurant to celebrate our anniversary and were very happy with how we were treated. The food was a little expensive in my opinion but given how amazing the customer service was, we feel like it√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s justified. Definitely will be recommending our friends here

Our favorite rooftop bar for the combination of a group of professional bartenders, range of drinks and great waiters. Outside seating was very comfortable (not the high seating) and service was constant and efficient. I think we came here 3 times. The happy hour is good value. They even gave my partner a wrap when it got cold. That wrap was clean and did the job. The lighted signs make this place attractive. The prices on the regular menu are high but the non happy hour cocktail (Le vie en rose) was very tasty. We had the canap√É¬© plate and we thought it was on the small side which is our only complaint. All in all a lovely spot to chill and yes meet some nice people.

This is a beautiful roof top bar with an amazing view and such an excellent service. Liam was kind enough to take some nice pictures of us and helped us select our drinks, the drinks are potent and delicious. The food was good and the vibe is amazing :) you√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢re greeted with such warmth that you feel like staying here! Highly recommended. It√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s cold so wear accordingly.

example_reviews: Hoang's Restaurant in Hanoi offers a delightful dining experience with a blend of traditional Vietnamese flavors and modern touches. The menu features an array of delicious local dishes, including flavorful pho and fresh spring rolls. The ambiance is cozy and welcoming, with attentive service that makes you feel right at home. It's a great spot for both casual meals and more intimate dinners, offering excellent value for the quality of food. Highly recommended for anyone wanting to explore authentic Vietnamese cuisine in a charming setting!

Food was great. Coconut coffee, egg cofee and the salted caramel coffee was tasty!Price is reasonable. Fast servcie! Staff are most helpful and very kind. Mai and the other staff were very attentive and made sure we were comfortable.

I had an amazing dining experience at Hoang Restaurant in Hanoi! The Vietnamese food was absolutely delicious ‚Äì every dish was packed with authentic flavors and beautifully presented. The highlight of my visit, however, was the fantastic service. The waiter captain was not only attentive but also incredibly fun and full of humor, which made the atmosphere so much more enjoyable. I highly recommend this place if you're looking for great food and a lively, welcoming vibe. I'll definitely be coming back! Very good service staff

name: Cau Go Vietnamese Cuisine Restaurant
address: No 9 Dinh Tien Hoang Street, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Nestled in the heart of Hanoi, Cau Go Vietnamese Cuisine celebrates the rich heritage of Vietnamese food and culture. Recognized in the Michelin Guide for two consecutive years, we are dedicated to preserving authentic flavors with fresh, locally sourced ingredients. From the vibrant flavors of the North to the bold spices of the Central and Southern regions, each dish tells a story of Vietnam‚Äôs diverse culinary traditions. With a breathtaking view of Hoan Kiem Lake, Cau Go Vietnamese Cuisine offers an elegant yet warm setting where guests can savor true Vietnamese cuisine while embracing the beauty of Hanoi.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
example_reviews: The welcome from downstairs, the short lift ride and arriving in this swish designer space with amazing view unto the lake and red bridge was already a good sign. We chose various dishes, all absolutely delicious, but for me the grilled squid on charcoal and the tender chayote greens were a hit. We also had deep fried vietnamese springrolls and bbq pork ribs. But the impeccable, friendly service from Vy, made it a memorable evening. We will be back. Thank you.

This time, we received very polite service and were able to enjoy our meal. Thank you very much. The staff kindly recommended menu items, which allowed us to enjoy delicious food. The atmosphere of the restaurant was also very comfortable, allowing us to relax and enjoy our meal. We would definitely like to use your restaurant again in the future. Thank you very much!

It was nice to be able to have a meal in a nice atmosphere while looking at the night view of the lake in the evening. A staff member named Pam complimented the menu, everything was delicious and she was really friendly. I especially recommend the eel dish. It's eaten like Vietnamese spring rolls, but it's delicious. The grilled squid is okay, but the sauce is really unique, but it's delicious. It goes well together. Even my dad, who doesn't like the unique leafy flavor, enjoyed it.

name: Steakout
address: 24 Tran Hung Dao, Hanoi Vietnam
description: This is difficult for me to say having spent most of my 58 years in Texas and Arizona, prime beef states both, the Steak Out served me one of the best steaks I have had in 15 years.  I don‚Äôt know whether we are feeding our beef too many drugs or what, but this steak was like the steaks of my youth.  Delicious! Sides were tasty and had a decent Australian Red by the glass.  If you need a little western fare, I highly recommend.  My sister agrees 100%!

since 5 weeks in Asia, this place saved us. Finally we found someone who knows how to prepare a steak, has very professional service team embedded in a nicely designed restaurant. From greeting till leaving, everything was perfect. The Pizza of our son, the apetizers, the steak and the ribs, all high quality. Yes a bit privy, but really worth it!

After a week of the best pho you will ever eat, it's nice to have something a little closer to home. This place fits the bill nicely. Well decorated and the service is good, but not fast. The servings were appropriately sized, not huge American portions. The hot pate and compound butter served with the bread basket was a nice touch. We had the sea bass and seafood squid-ink pasta, both were very good. We will probably try it again before going home. It would have been nice to have at least one traditional Vietnamese dish for those in our party who were still enthusiastic about going local.

name: Quan Que Restaurant
address: 80 P. M√£ M√¢y, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Located at the 80 M√£ M√¢y St, one of the most oldest street in Hanoi's Old Quarter. The historic building is situated amid the quaint winding streets. A great place for Group or individual travelers, local people who wants to enjoy Authentic Vietnamese Cuisine and beverage. Restaurants offers private or common rooms within 300 seats at one time and great point to arrange for any special Events. Quan Que reminds you to think about the beautiful picturesque Vietnamese‚Äôs rural markets, which is really colorful of Cuisine & Culture.
