As we turned onto the street we saw two large queues - one was JUST for delivery drivers to pick up for take out/delivery, and one was for people on foot to takeaway. We knew from the queues it must be good! They don't have a menu as it's just one option - again - sign of someone who knows what they're doing vs a jack of all trades and master of none. Queue was big but wait wasn't long bas they have such a good system and production line going on in there! Can't remember exactly the cost but think around $3USD or something equally as cheap for what really could've been split between two not just for one person! They give you the bread with various cuts of meat with the pate and mayo wrapped up, and then little bags of the salad bits to add inside (1 x cucumber, 1 x pickled radishes, 1 x spring onions and herbs). I honestly can't describe how tasty the whole combo was! Gotta try it!

The French bread, crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside, is crispier, fluffier, and softer than the real French bread, which seems to be due to the fact that Vietnamese bread is made from rice flour. I liked this better than the real French bread, which is filled with at least five different kinds of ham, pate, pork char siu, chicken ham, meat floss, onion chips, etc., and vegetables such as fresh cucumber, radish and carrot namasu, pak choi, green onion, fresh chilies, etc., are served separately and can be topped according to your preference. Vegetables such as fresh cucumber, radish, carrot, pak choi, green onion and fresh chili are served separately and can be topped as desired. The price is reasonable and the food is too good to be true.

name: Vietnam House Restaurant
address: 93-95-97 Dong Khoi, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: A Vietnamese cuisine with a Modern Twist restaurant lies in the heart of Saigon that amaze your appetite The restored colonial building on the corner of Dong Khoi and Mac Thi Buoi in the heart of the city once housed the famed Caf√© L‚ÄôImperial in the early 1900s, and was a popular destination for the city‚Äôs affluent business class. The new Vietnam House Restaurant is set to bring back the nostalgia and charm of this storied street corner, and introduce a new generation to the sublime qualities of of Vietnamese food at its finest.
example_reviews: Very delicious local food and great service. Super attentive and helpful. In particular Nu, an exceptional waitress. Everything is very clean and, in addition, a very very beautiful decoration of the land. Air conditioning is appreciated. Super attentive and different dishes: transparent lobster rolls, purple rice with shrimp and chicken with lemon sauce, highly recommended. This is the only reason I would go. And a delicious coffee. It is not the cheapest but the price is worth it. I recommend it.

We decided almost at the end of our holiday. In Vietnam to treat ourselves to a dinner in one of the best and elegant restaurants in Saigon. The restaurant is located in the center, a stone's throw from the best hotels and tourist attractions of the city. The location, although a little dated, is very elegant with crystal booths with colored inlays. The menu includes typical local dishes with dishes not so dissimilar from others tasted in other restaurants, I ordered a classic as a starter, Fresh Rolls with prawns and pork followed by a duck breast cooked in two ways with tomato and pepper sauce with bok choi and smashed potatoes, both very elegant dishes and truly excellent on the palate. The service is absolutely professional, you are accompanied and followed right from the moment you enter the room. Naturally the prices are much higher than the Vietnamese average, absolutely normal for us Italians

Having the opportunity to enjoy the anniversary special course dinner was truly wonderful. On previous visits to Vietnam, my schedule never aligned, so I was thrilled to finally seize the chance to dine there this time. Each course was a masterpiece, meticulously crafted and beautifully presented. While it wasn‚Äôt inexpensive compared to typical prices in Vietnam, I believe it was a unique and memorable experience worth every penny. The servers were highly professional and impeccably trained, contributing to what was, in every way, a perfect dining experience.

name: 33 De Tham Restaurant
address: 33 De Tham Street Co Giang Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Our restaurant was founded in 1997, and offers an extensive menu of freshly cooked authentic Vietnamese food, at a reasonable price. We pride ourselves on great food, warm friendly service and a memorable dining experience. No matter if you are a solo traveler or large group, we can accommodate you with a wide variety of meat, seafood and vegetable dishes. You will never be disappointed when eating in our restaurant. Welcome!
example_reviews: Perfect quiet restaurant amidst the hustle and bustle with extremely nice staff and very delicious food. I didn't know I ordered a dish to be rolled with rice paper, but my waiter Jack taught me that well. A clear recommendation !

What a delightful surprise find this restaurant is! Fresh and delicious ingredients - the seafood! - at a ridiculously cheap price. Serving sizes are also very generous. The food more than compensates for basic surroundings. Limited English skills from the very hospitable staff counteracted by pointing at menu (in English and on website) and Google translator. Part of the adventure being the only non-locals there! After our first visit, we brought decent wine glasses and wine. No corkage, they provide an ice bucket. Perfection!

This was our revisit after our last visit in 2019 (before Covid19) and that left us great impression and so decided to revisit again. The restaurant is located in De Tham street, where many family restaurants are located. If you are a first time visitor, you maybe spoiled for choice which restaurant to visit as all look "good"! For us, without hesitation, we went to this restaurant. And surprisingly it was quite empty although it was 7.30pm in the evening. Only 2 tables were occupied (on 2nd storey, including ours). Think Covid19 has hit hard on the small and medium businesses here. We ordered the pork ribs with fried rice, BBQ clams, stir fried cauliflowers and water spinach and deep fried chicken. We didn't order the BBQ oysters and beef dishes as we just had them the night before and wanted something "light". Portions were huge, And the food were yummy, well marinated and cooked to perfection, consistently good no doubt in that! And prices were reasonable too, despite of inflation, the price did not rise or rise slightly like 5000 dong only. Our dinner at around 220,000 dong. We didn't order any drink as we had plan to visit a cafe for iced beverages as the weather was warm. And it took us 10mins via Grab to get back to Saigon Center for our drinks then!

name: Li Bai Authentic Cantonese Restaurant
address: 88 Dong Khoi Street Ben Nghe Ward, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Experience authentic Cantonese cuisine reimagined for the modern palate curated by seasoned chefs.
example_reviews: Libai Dim Sum Brunch ‚Äì A Place That Feels Like Home For 17 years, my family and I have been coming to Libai Dim Sum Brunch, and it never fails to bring us warmth and joy. Every visit feels special, like stepping into a familiar place filled with delicious food and heartfelt hospitality. The dim sum here is simply perfect‚Äîchar siu bao is soft and flavorful, the pastries are crisp and golden, and every bite is crafted with authentic flavors. The service is truly five-star, with staff who are always welcoming and attentive, making us feel valued and at home. Whether for a celebration or a casual brunch, Libai never disappoints. It‚Äôs more than just a restaurant; it‚Äôs a cherished tradition where love, family, and great food come together. For the best dim sum in HCM, this is the place to be!

The service of "Man" is good and today we had a nice night with family. Duck is delicious and the atmosphere is good. About $50 per person. Mega Members also enjoy a 10% discount. If you stay here, it is recommended to eat.

A wonderful dim sum buffet. Lot of choice and amazing quality. Maybe the best one in HCMC. And quite affordable during the week. And if you are lost regarding the extended menu, the team can advise you on the dim sum relevant to your taste. And by the way, the main dishes, apart from the dim sum, are quite tasty too.

name: The Deck Saigon
address: 38 Nguyen U Di Thao Dien, Ho Chi Minh City 10000 Vietnam
description:
Fusion menu,you can have full vietnamese or full western or everything in between, pages of cocktails service is velvet perfect.costs less than a cafe in Aust. We had chefs degustation ,5 star just go!  It is incredible value and a wonderful outing.
10-20 minutes from district 1 by taxi
example_reviews: Fusion menu,you can have full vietnamese or full western or everything in between, pages of cocktails service is velvet perfect.costs less than a cafe in Aust. We had chefs degustation ,5 star just go! It is incredible value and a wonderful outing. 10-20 minutes from district 1 by taxi

We dined at The Deck Saigon in Thao Dien recently and while the food was satisfying, we found the pricing and service to be disappointing. Despite being forewarned by some locals, my wife and I decided to give it a shot. The riverside seating offered a pleasant ambience, but the service left much to be desired. The main drawback here is the prices, considering that similar quality can be found with service to match. It wasn‚Äôt bad service, just inattentive and seemed to not know the menu. We are willing to give it another shot in the future to see if the experience improves. Everybody has off days.

Well worth the short trip through the suburbs, The Deck offers a stunning example of intelligent "fusion" cuisine with a perfectly orchestrated mix of local (pancakes or spring rolls ) and Western classics ( carpaccios or ceviches). The impeccable service is in tune with the flawless freshness of all the products. Everything, including the bread and amuse-gueules, was delicious. The team in the kitchen got an unanimous approval from our group of six seasoned travellers who all chose different dishes. Surrounded by magnificent orchids, we enjoyed the peaceful view of Saigon River at our feet, as the meal progressed so smoothly that we forgot for a moment that Sa√Øgon was re-baptized nearly 50 years ago. The Paris of the East is still well alive in many places across the city and this is definitely one of them . Heartfelt congratulations.

name: Ros Yacht Club
address: 10B Ton Duc Thang Bach Dang Harbor, Ben Nghe, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Inspired by the restaurant ‚ÄúLa Pointe Des Blagueurs‚Äù, then the caf√© ‚ÄúJokers‚Äô Point‚Äù, built in the same place at Bach Dang harbor - a popular destination of Saigon during the country‚Äôs tumultuous 1950s, after nearly 7 decades, ROS was established and revivified in 2019. Building on the history of the area while sewing ourselves into the fabric of future gives us the opportunity to become a gatekeeper to the city ‚Äì a key player in Saigon‚Äôs food and drink scene. ROS is a day-to-night, Pan-Asian restaurant with nautical vibes and a hint of Cote d‚ÄôAzur style. More than just an exquisite meal with a panoramic riverfront view, dining experience at ROS meant to engage all of the senses by offering a chance to savor an innovative Pan-Asian cuisine, sip on a range of exotic cocktails, and immerse yourself in the serenity of Saigon river.
example_reviews: Have a chance to have lunch here with your family. The space is decorated modernly and luxuriously. My family ordered the set menu - Vietnamese food including 1 salad, 1 stir-fried vegetable, 3 salty dishes, 1 soup. The food is seasoned very well, the family really likes the braised fish dish - suitable for entertaining after the Tet season with braised eggs and meat. Seating space is available indoors and outside at noon, from evening outside, very suitable for romantic dates. The reception and service staff are very enthusiastic. My family and I went to the room that they helped us arrange to sit in the VIP room, and Duyen served our family wholeheartedly throughout the afternoon today.

Last Saturday morning, my girlfriend and I went to have breakfast at ROS restaurant. We accidentally found out about the restaurant because we took the Water bus in District 1. The two of us ordered shrimp noodle soup and beef pho. The noodle soup is delicious, the broth is light, rich in shrimp flavor but a bit off for me. Beef pho is served in a stone bowl so the broth stays hot, has a strong flavor of cinnamon and anise, and is quite delicious. In particular, I find the milk coffee here delicious because I like to drink strong, sweet, bitter coffee. However, because the morning is quite sunny, I think sitting indoors will be cooler and less glare. If I have a chance, I will come back again.

I came one afternoon waiting for my friends to start dinner. Since you haven't arrived yet, I decided to sit at the bar to enjoy a cocktail. Right at happy hour, it's only 89k per drink. The drinks recommended by the bartenders are very suitable to my taste, they are very enthusiastic and fun. After that, I moved to the river bank to have dinner. The food is delicious and unique, there is a slight minus point: I came on the weekend so I had to wait a bit but it's okay, the experience is still very good, the service people are very enthusiastic. Will come back in the near future.

name: Cafe de L‚ÄôOpera
address: 19-23 Lam Son Square Caravelle Hotel, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City 70000 Vietnam
description: Cafe de l‚ÄôOpera is quite possibly in the best location in our city, that‚Äôs if you enjoy your views with a dash of history and a slice of modernity all rolled into one. The cafe is located on the ground floor of the hotel on the corner of historic Dong Khoi Street and Lam Son Square, just metres across from Saigon‚Äôs iconic municipal theatre, better known as the Opera House. During the day, as temperatures soar and the heavens threaten to open, Cafe de l‚ÄôOpera becomes a refuge for travellers and the like, just as it always has been since the hotel doors opened in the 50s. Over high-tea, things slow down, friends catch-up, business associates meet and lovers hold hands. By night, things become lively again with tapas, cocktails and wine to the sounds of jazz and the excited chatter of guests enjoying an extended Happy Hour as the city comes alive again.
example_reviews: Opera Caf√©, nestled within the opulent surroundings of a five-star hotel, is an ideal destination for those who appreciate a refined atmosphere and top-notch service. From the moment you step inside, you'll be captivated by the modern interior design, which seamlessly blends with classic elements to create a space that is both cozy and elegant. Hoai and Tram very cute.

During my short visit to Caravelle Saigon, I found myself captivated by the enchanting atmosphere of the Opera Caffe. The elegant d√©cor and soothing music created a classy and sophisticated ambiance. The staff were incredibly attentive and always ready to engage in delightful discussions. Whether it was sharing travel stories or exploring cultural nuances, their genuine warmth and knowledge made the experience truly memorable. I highly recommend visiting this gem in Saigon for a tranquil and inclusive environment that fosters connections.

The cafe is located in a very prime location, it covers a central area with impressive views. Coming here to drink morning coffee, eat a bowl of pho, read a newspaper and look at the street is something worth experiencing. They also have attentive friendly service. What a perfect way to start my day!

name: Hoa T√∫c
address: 74/7 Hai Ba Trung, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Hoa Tuc - "Poppy" - came from the owners‚Äô desire to explore new avenues in Vietnamese cooking. Food in Vietnam has been stuck in a stiff ‚Äúmold‚Äù with every chef in the country churning out the same food over and over, year after year.
example_reviews: Very tasty and well presented dishes served very competently by Oanh. Four diners shared veggie and other dishes and all were more than satisfied. Wine was reasonably priced and we enjoyed eating outdoors in this very busy restaurant. Hard to find but worth looking for.

Been to this restaurant twice on a business trip. It's a little hard to find without special knowledge ) but eventually figured out the location. In the evening you usually need a reservation, but we were lucky and waited no more than 5 minutes . Good service, waiters give good advice on choosing and eating some special dishes. Pleasant atmosphere and interior. And of course, Asian food is delicious.

We had the pleasure of dining at Hoa T√∫c during our recent trip to Ho Chi Minh City, and it was a fantastic experience. We believe we first visited this restaurant 25 years ago, and it‚Äôs just as impressive today! Set in a beautifully restored colonial building that once served as an opium refinery, Hoa T√∫c offers a charming atmosphere and a unique culinary experience. Their concept of ‚ÄúVietnamese Cuisine with a Contemporary Twist‚Äù is both creative and authentic. The Food: ‚Ä¢ Starters: ‚Ä¢ C√° th√°c l√°c chi√™n gi√≤n (Crispy featherback fish cakes): Perfectly cooked and full of flavor. ‚Ä¢ B√≤ l√° l·ªët (Grilled minced beef wrapped in betel leaf): A standout dish, tender and packed with aromatic spices. ‚Ä¢ Mains: ‚Ä¢ S∆∞·ªùn non m·∫≠t ong n∆∞·ªõng (Grilled honey pork ribs): Sweet, savory, and perfectly tender, complemented by pickled shallots and lemongrass. ‚Ä¢ C√† t√≠m x√†o s·ªët sa t·∫ø / C√† t√≠m n∆∞·ªõng (Eggplant with sat√© sauce / Grilled eggplant): Both variations were delicious, but the sat√© sauce added a delightful kick. The Service: The staff were friendly, attentive, and genuinely welcoming, which enhanced our overall dining experience. Hoa T√∫c is a must-visit for anyone looking to explore the vibrant flavors of Vietnamese cuisine in a unique and historic setting. We can‚Äôt wait to return!

name: Mad Cow Saigon Wine & Grill
address: 148 ƒê. Tr·∫ßn H∆∞ng ƒê·∫°o Level 30, Pullman Saigon Centre, Ho Chi Minh City 700000 Vietnam
description: Mad Cow Wine & Grill, the signature restaurant of Pullman Saigon Centre, redefines the dining scene with its innovative steakhouse concept. Located on the 30th floor, this venue offers stunning rooftop views of Saigon. Our menu features the legendary Tomahawk steak and a selection of locally sourced tapas. Whether for a special occasion or an intimate dinner, Mad Cow Wine & Grill delivers unforgettable dining experiences in a vibrant, cosmopolitan setting. Discover why it‚Äôs one of Saigon‚Äôs finest dining destinations.
example_reviews: We had a great experience thanks to Nhi, who was incredibly friendly and helpful. She gave us great recommendations on what to order and clearly explained the ingredients when we had questions ‚Äî very thoughtful, especially for those with dietary needs. Nhi also shared some great local tips on places to eat and visit nearby, which really added to our trip. Thank you, Nhi, for making our visit extra special!

The private dining room with a phenomenal view was the perfect spot for a big family birthday. The staff were so helpful in setting up balloons and decorations - Tien was just delightful! The food was spectacular - my fillet steak with bernaise sauce was just glorious. My only reservation was with the wine: any kind of deep full bodied red would really rattle the purse.

We were all very impressed with the breakfast, lunch and dinner, especially the seafood dinner on the 6th of April. The hotel staff, especially those in the 3rd floor dining room, maintain an excellent standard and are a credit to the hotel. Thank you all for a very enjoyable stay. Ken Butler and Carol Humble. Room 1706 [4th until the 7th of April 2025].

name: Pasteur Street Craft Beer - Cua Bac Taproom
address: 30 Cua Bac, Truc Bach, Ba Dinh,, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: A charming, cozy but lively taproom in the historic Ba Dinh district. The taproom has two floors, each with a unique atmosphere and view. The ground floor is warm and inviting with artwork posters, while the balcony is cool and relaxing, with a stunning view of the bustling streets from a nice balcony.
example_reviews: We found Pasteur Street Craft Beer ‚Äì C∆∞a B·∫Øc Taproom & Restaurant on our first night in Hanoi, and ended up coming back multiple times! The beer is fantastic, and the food is just as impressive. They have 16 beers on tap‚Äî10 of their signature brews and 6 rotating seasonal options‚Äîso there‚Äôs always something new to try. On our first visit, I ordered a tasting flight of six beers and loved every single one. My favorites were the Pomelo IPA and the Passion Fruit Wheat Ale, and I could easily sip the Bia Chanh Mu·ªëi (a low-alcohol salted lime beer) all day long. My husband, an IPA fan, really enjoyed the Session IPA, and we both loved the Double Jasmine IPA. David was incredibly friendly and helpful, encouraging us to explore the different styles and offering great suggestions along the way. The food was awesome, too! The menu is extensive, ranging from burgers and wings (both excellent!) to creative salads and dishes featuring Vietnamese ingredients. Even better‚Äîthey sell their beer in affordable 1-liter growlers, so you can bring your favorites home. If you love craft beer and great food in a relaxed setting, this spot is a must-visit! If I could give Pasteur Street Craft Beer more than 5 stars, I would!
So much life passing by, great beer...the Blonde was fab but sadly ran out. It would have been 5 stars but the nuts were crap. Sweet otatoe fries were battered but still tasty. Lovely staff.

The atmosphere of this place is great, quite bustling and modern. Some of the beer flavors I tried were delicious. We also had some spicy chicken, which was great. The staff are also very friendly. Overall, this place is bang for our buck

name: La Table du Chef Restaurant Hanoi
address: 59A Ly Thai To 3rd Floor, Press Club Building, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Set in its original colonial d√©cor from the 1920's, La Table du Chef is a subtle journey into fine crafts, paintings, culinary and winemaking arts sourced from Vietnam and France. In the same way that Herm√®s workshop was once defined as a song of gestures, lovers of haute cuisine are invited to hunt for traces left by the hand's gestures embedded into many aspects of the decoration of the restaurant. This story appealed to two Michelin-star chef Alain Dutournier who had selected La Table du Chef to bring his art of haute cuisine for the first time outside of France. He adheres so intimately to the concept that Alain now personifies the soul of La Table du Chef and his hands are the expression of the highest culinary art. Together with his talented Vietnamese Resident Chef, Dao Van Son, he brings to La Table du Chef the highest standard of excellence in French cuisine, with a touch of Vietnamese taste. In this artistic atmosphere, gastronomes will have a chance to discover an exceptional menu, highlighting the best local and imported products delivered daily, such as Foie Gras from Landes, Truffle from Perigord, Fleur de sel from Guerande, Duct from South Western France, Sapa's honey, Phu Quoc's pepper... These exquisite dishes are carefully paired with the most refined selection of wines to create a memorable culinary experience in the heart of Hanoi's French quarter. The very explanatory wine menu proposes 450 labels from most famous producers of the world, a majority of French wines, as well as wonderful discoveries from Alain Dutournier, all stored in the open cellar on site.
cuisines: BBQ Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
example_reviews: Ordered the set dinner so the dishes were pre-set. The starter, soup and main were good. Not quite like the dessert because we were not a sweet person. Overall, happy with it.
I visit this place a few times and have a quite mixed opinion. Sometimes it's amazing and other times can be just average.

As soon as arrived in Hanoi bt plane my family wanted to eat western food so I reserved lunch in La Table du Chef. As I expected the presentation was excellent and the food was delicious! There was a 3 course special lunch meal for 600,000 and it was more than you can expect for this price. The staff was friendly and offered an excellent desert dish for our son athough he did not order as he was tired and dizzy from his flight. I definitely recommend this to restaurant for a treat during your stay in Hanoi. (Note that it seemed around me there were mostly formal business luncheons and I regret i didn‚Äôt wear a more formal atire)

name: Gent Steak+
address: 95 B√πi Th·ªã Xu√¢n, Hanoi 84 Vietnam
description: Just happened to pass by this restaurant and decided to come in for a try. My first impression was that the staffs here take care of their customers really well, they even prepared birthday dishes as gifts for the reserved tables. The food here is quite wonderful and diverse, from classics to fusion dishes while still made it easy for customers to consume, definitely recommend the Beef Rossini and the Wayu Salmon . Beverages are not as diverse but didn't make it less delicious, we ordered some cocktails for the evening and I feel like the Golden Hour and Whisdream are must try. Overall my experience here is wonderful, worth the price, if you're travelling and want to try something different traditional Vietnamese food, I highly recommend you give this place a try.
example_reviews: Just happened to pass by this restaurant and decided to come in for a try. I visited a restaurant to book a table to celebrate my wife's birthday, and received free, quite romantic decorations. The food was delicious, my husband and I both ate all the dishes, especially my wife loved the soft Fuji Steak. The staff were welcoming, even singing happy birthday and giving away cakes, my wife was very happy. Thank you Gent.

On the evening of March 15, my family and I went to experience the facility at 95 Bui Thi Xuan. My whole family was very satisfied with the food as well as the enthusiastic and attentive service. I will definitely come back one day in the near future

name: Cafe Goethe
address: 56 Nguyen Thai Hoc Ba D√¨nh, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: I've eaten at this restaurant twice and found the food to be quite salty. The first time I found it salty and told the waiter, the second time I ate here I still found it quite salty. Maybe it's because the chef is used to cooking with a lot of salt?
cuisines: Late Night Mexican Restaurants in Hanoi
Late Night Middle Eastern Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: I've eaten at this restaurant twice and found the food to be quite salty. The first time I found it salty and told the waiter, the second time I ate here I still found it quite salty. Maybe it's because the chef is used to cooking with a lot of salt?

Situated in the premises of the German Cultural Institute this restaurant with a warm interior design and and outside area offers a lot of traditional German dishes as well as Vietnamese food. You get locally brewed German draft beer. I was there several times the Food is ok , like in a German brewhouse. The staff is nice , it is often packed for lunchtime and sometimes very noisy as people there like to talk a lot.

Wonderful place to sit and talk. Food i had chosen was average, mashed potatoes tasted strange, also the almost green colour was strange and a red Sauerkraut i never ate in my lifeüòÇ - because it was Blaukraut. But who will know this in detail outside Germany. Espresso could be improved as wel, no crema and too much water.

name: Pho Bo, Ga
address: 32 Bat Dan Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: I have a fondness for Vietnamese specialties especially pho, this restaurant is located at 32 Bat Dan Hoan Kiem, Hanoi. There are many types of pho here for you to choose from such as chicken pho, beef noodle soup, the broth of the pho is not the best but I think it's acceptable for the price. The tables and chairs used here are all plastic and everything is not cleaned, so it is quite inconvenient for us to eat here, My friend is a clean person so he does not like the restaurant here very much. . The Restaurant should change and clean things up
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi

Pho Bo restaurant has delicious and appetizing food, beef is added to the food quite a lot and it is delicious, the seasoning is seasoned to my taste. The broth is quite good and the side dishes are vegetables. They have ready-made spices for everyone to choose and add themselves. However, in my opinion, this restaurant is really not very comfortable, they should change other furniture and equipment and should clean it more. Really hard to choose it to come next time.

We stopped here for lunch and enjoyed the chicken Pho which was excellent. At nearly 6 feet tall it was a struggle for me to sit on the tiny stalls - but sure was worth the effort! It was great to experience traditional food in a traditional no thrills setting. It's a must if you are in the Old Quarter and want some authentic fare. Thank you.

name: Nao Bistro
address: 26 Tr·∫ßn B√¨nh Tr·ªçng, Ph∆∞·ªùng Nguy·ªÖn Du, Qu·∫≠n Hai B√† Tr∆∞ng, H√† N·ªôi, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: NAO Bistro is a rustic hideaway, a quiet corner for anyone seeking a moment of calm. Surrounded by greenery and gentle lighting, this cozy spot invites you to slow down, sip organic coffee, enjoy Vietnamese specialty teas, and savor wholesome vegan dishes. Come, sit with us at NAO Bistro, and simply enjoy the peacefulness.

name: Lecker
address: S·ªë 55 Ph·ªë V·ªá H·ªì, Hanoi 11206 Vietnam
description:
We selected the mixed platter so we could try a little of everything the kitchen had to offer and nothing disappointed.

The home baked bread was excellent as were the rosemary potatoes. The best sausages we have had in Hanoi.

Located on a quiet stretch of the road around west lake, there is plenty of space for motorcycles.

Well priced for the quality of the food.

We do not drink but we understand the draft German beer is excellent

address: 12 Hang Luoc Next to Masjid Al Noor, Hang Ma, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: It is a small restaurant just beside the mosque. Easy to find because it is within the walking distance from city center. nice food and coffee. Price wise was quite on the expensive side for local cuisine but since it was hard to find halal food, the price was justified.
cuisines: French Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi

There is a small halal restaurant just beside the mosque. Its entrance is not facing the main street. Find where they park motorbikes, and you will find the Zynab restaurant entrance. There are about 4 tables. It opens at 11 am. Come early, eat and quickly make space for others. The food is good. A wide selection of Western, Arabic and local Vietnamese-style foods. The price range is between 100-250k dong.

love the foods! I was told that this restaurant close at 4 pm but when we came, the waiter said it close at 6 pm! they have a limited choice of food. the curry was delicious. the grilled chicken was nice and big portion.

name: Edo Japanese Restaurant
address: 360 Kim Ma Street 1st Floor, Hanoi Daewoo Hotel, Ba Dinh District, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: With fresh imported seafood, Teppanyaki and a selection of beautifully presented sushi and sashimi, Edo offers an authentic Japanese dining experience in a refined environment. Pair your meal with one of premium sakes. 04 VIP dining rooms are available for private event, business lunch, family or friends reunion.
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: I would highly recommend visiting this restaurant if you want to experience high-quality Japanese cuisine in Hanoi. With its beautiful ambiance, professional service, and diverse menu, I would have a fantastic meal and a memorable experience here. Although the prices may be higher than some other restaurants, the quality and great service at here justify every penny I spent.

Happened to stumble upon this restaurant and I'm glad I did. The experience was incredible and the service was beyond outstanding. We had "Chef Hai," who was entertaining throughout the experience and was extremely friendly. Definitely check out this spot when you have the time, I will definitely be going back.
teppanyaki was great and entertaining! Service staffs were attentive and cool! Would love to dine back !

name: Ab Sushi
address: 01 Thu·ª∑ Nguy√™n, Ecopark T·∫ßng 2 cafe ƒêi·ªán B√°o, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: In Japan, getting that sushi rice right is seen as the highest art. Also at AB Sushi, Sushi rice is not only meticulously processed from the talented hands of a professional chef who has a lot of experience with Japanese cuisine, but also has freshly fish freshly fish are carefully prepared and cleaned evryday . Definitely will satisfy all the most demanding diners.
cuisines: American Restaurants with Buffet in Hanoi
example_reviews: My family's favorite restaurant. Staff were all professional and made you feel like valued customers. Food was all good: fresh sashimi, grilled saba fish, sushi (many different types of sushi).. Try the cordyceps mushroom hot pot and noodles that come with beef. Even the dessert greek yogurt (with pearl) was delicious. The menu is regularly refreshed with many dishes. Definitely worth a visit. Good value for $20 dinner set per person considering the food quality, service and restaurant setting.

My partner and I were walking in the area and decided to stop at this lovely looking place for food. We were immediately charmed by the great ambiance, fresh sashimis, delicious tuna rolls, incredible service. A total gem!

OMG I had such an amazing experience that I thought this place was a godsend. After visiting our relatives in Eco Park, my family needed something to eat for dinner. Then we stumbled upon this quaint little restaurant and were pleasantly surprised. The place itself was rather small but tidy with lovely atmosphere. The service was excellent with very accommodating staff. As a sushi snob, I give this place my approval. The food was fresh, super authentic and delicious. The salmon avocado salad is to die for. The bathroom was clean too, so I undoubtedly rate this place a 10/10. So so good, thank you!

name: Restaurant - Cafe CCCP
address: 103 Lane 84 Ngoc Khanh Giang Vo, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: This is a good restaurant. I came here my boyfriend before he left to China. I went back again before I leave Vietnam. I realize I like the food we ordered so I ordered them again. I feel I knew more of him as we went to this place together. I realize what I want when I came back alone. I really love their food and how simple ingredients can create great flavors.
cuisines: Late Night Mediterranean Restaurants in Hanoi
Middle Eastern Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi

Food was ok, well seasoned with big portion. For those who love Russian cuisine, this one should be the place in the list. Service, however, was a bit unfriendly and slow.

I have read many good reviews about this place. I love ‚Äúblack bread‚Äù and here in Hanoi, it is hard to get good ones. I went there according to ‚Äúless busy hour‚Äù on one of the web-sites (as I have read it is a busy place; the service may need to improve, etc), which was at 3 pm. As on their face book page, the working hour was from 11am to 10 pm, also having name‚Äù Cafe‚Äù, I could not believe a man who was their (seems the part of owner family) told me ‚Äúin Vietnam, every restaurant must have lunch break‚Äù and told me to go back. The cafes in my neighborhood are open from the early morning to night, by the way.... ‚ÄúWeill then, please change, as your are open from 11 am to 2pm and 5 pm to 10 pm‚Äù as a kindness. At that moment, the lady of the restaurant said ‚Äúsince you have come here, we offer what we have‚Äù. Thanks to her, I was able to eat very good black bread and borscht. I have asked only to have black bread as I don‚Äôt eat white wheat and I did not them to waste any. But lady insisted. Funny thing is that a person who were in the kitchen quietly told me, ‚Äúplease do not worry, here, nothing would get wasted. This bread will be used as bread crumbs later.‚Äù Well... those who eat any fried cutlet, please keep that in mind... For the kindness of the lady, I give 4 stars.

A good place for a quick bite. There is a modern atmosphere with good service and food. The menu offers a variety of options. The food (while good and presented pretty) was not inspiring. It lacked some flavor.
The choices were good. There were plenty to choose from the menu but they hardly tasted. And for the records, I even make better Thai hotpot at home. Staff were good and polite.

name: Mon Ngon Sai Thanh Restaurant
address: 59A Huynh Thuc Khang Street, Dong Da District, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Our first night in Hanoi and we had no idea where to go for dinner, so we asked at our hotel reception what they would recommend. The ladies suggested the Mon Ngon Sai Thanh, at Da Tuong, just along the road from our hotel. We enjoyed a very tasty meal of pork and shrimps with a caramelised sauce and beef and bell peppers. Most of the staff spoke a little English, and were very happy to oblige when we had trouble understanding the menu. Our meal was delicious and we would certainly return to try more of the great food served here. Highly recommend this restaurant.

Food is served pretty fast. Their soup is one of the best I have tasted, it's tasty and not bland like most. The prawns are big and juicy. Noodle soup has plenty of ingredients and soup is yummy. Definitely should visit here for food, but its slightly pricier than regular restaurants.

We walked in and up 3 flights to find a table in this great restaurant that is very popular with local people...always a good sign. We had stir fried pork and chicken, some seafood fried rice with some soft drinks. Food choice and quality was great and there was a great buzz with lots of local parties enjoying their Friday lunchtime. Would happily come back here and would recommend it.

name: Chibo
address: Number 5, 535 Kim Ma, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Chibo brand was created in Osaka in 1973. In 1992, 7-storey Okonomiyaki building in downtown Dotonbori was completed, including luxury brands Purejidento Chibo specializing in Teppanyaki, meanwhile, has created buzz Culinary large community in particular and in general all over Japan. Osaka is a land famous for culinary Kuidaore neighborhood, among them, typically cakes Okonomiyaki and grilled octopus Takoyaki . Currently, Okonomiyaki are specialties, won the love of not only the parts of the country throughout Japan but also foreign tourists. However, it is still considered unique culture, born from the soil of Osaka. Okonomiyaki plump cake, smear mayonnaise, sprinkle seaweed, fish tissue have great taste when enjoyed by Teko. For diners can enjoy delicious cuisine and attractive at Chibo, we always pay attention to the following factors: Mae aji, Naka AIJ, Ato aji, including: Mae aji impression about food and restaurants ; Naka aj: Taste cakes Okonomiyaki, Ato aji: Comment of the customer after eating and left the restaurant. We absolutely do not take any light of it at all! Okonomiyaki pancake dish was strange, not traditional Japanese cuisine, dishes nor Chinese, European dishes. It's great when everyone gathered around the grill, enjoy a hot Okonomiyaki cake, talking incessantly, creating a closed loop inside of the excitement, enthusiasm. We call it an Okonomiyaki conversation (Okonomiyaki communication) and really appreciate it.
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: I can say Chibo is one of the best Japanese restaurants in Hanoi. Living in Hanoi for a few years, I visited many of the Japanese restarts that are highly recommened in many other webs and apps. Chibo has lots of different options you can choose from, noodles Okonomiyaki, and sushi. I actually order more than 5 menus to satisfy myself haha. I wanna give 5 stars or more if possible
Favorite okonomiyaki in town. Great variety of option in the menu and all tasted amazing so far. Great place for family and children.

Me and my partner been to Chibo in Osaka and had a very bad experience with their service. Now in Hanoi, we decided to give it another shot and were pleased with the experience. The staff is very polite and attentive, okonomiyaki is has a very authentic taste. We were seated in a private cabin so it was quite and cozy. A bit upset that they didn‚Äôt cook the food on our grill table, but rather brought a ready made okonomiyaki from the kitchen. But overall, we are happy. Will come back!

example_reviews: My wife chose this place as a surprise to celebrate my birthday, and honestly I'm very glad she did. They have a good selection of the 2 mil vnd set menu, and the atmosphere was very cozy, although the pairing wine would have been a bit better. The best thing was after the meal, the restaurant manager found out that our bill was wrong (we didn't notice we were over charged cuz we were enjoying our time there), and she called my wife to offer a refund. That's what I called a very attentive and wholesome service. Well done guys! I'll be back for sure.

My family of 4 recently had dinner at Studios and the experience was unforgettable. Every dishes has it own color but for me, I particularly enjoyed Pie Tee and Beef Tartare. The flavors were perfectly balanced, and the ingredients were fresh and of high quality. The portion size was also perfect, leaving us comfortably full without feeling stuffed. The restaurant itself had a warm atmosphere. The music was at a pleasant volume, allowing us to easily converse. Will coming back and am really excited to see the new menu to try out

The restaurant serves an artistic style combining cuisine and handmade drinks. This is the first time I have experienced this style. The quality of the food is nothing to criticize, and the pairing drinks are also excellent. Compared to such quality, the price is very reasonable. I will definitely come back often.

example_reviews: Little restaurant tucked away (sort of) and on the water at West Lake - away from the centre so quieter and cheaper‚Ä¶. Great, simple menu (ie not overfacing with too much complex choice, but hits all the right notes) Great drinks menu (had the first pisco sour I‚Äôve seen out here - and it was excellent!!). Staff were attentive and knowledgable and could t have been the right side of friendly and without being intrusive. Food arrived quickly and was absolutely wonderful - large portions of fresh tasty fare. Would highly recommend

What a find! Neat little place, with air on upstairs if needed. Tortilla chips while not made onsite come out warm, guac is really tasty though a touch more also and cilantro would be awesome. Tacos are excellent!

I strongly recommend their shrimp taco. The tempura fish taco was really good also. A bit strange that they ran out all wine bottles in their list (all 20 kinda types of wines) so we had to buy a bottle at the warehouse nearby. They were nice not to charge us extra fee on outside drinks as usual so we ordered tequila also and it was good. Services was great. Nice ambient to sit outside by the lake. A bit disappointed that the ceviche was not as good as few years ago when they first opened on Tu Hoa.

We popped in here for a quick lunch. First of all, it is super cheap and great value. Only 5 dishes on the menu - super quick service, fresh food, tasty and also seems popular with the locals. Suited us perfect for a quick lunch.

After walking for a long time in the Old Quarter, my friend and I were hungry by 9pm. We had lots of Pho Bo and Bun Cha in the last few days, and we wanted some alternatives. This stall offers very good egg noodles (Wonton noodles) and also the Dry Phnom Peng Noodles were fantastic! We will certainly return to this stall again!

We loved the paper burger holders that are provided on the tables allowing you to eat your burger as tidily as can be possible.
example_reviews: We had an amazing lunch at SunKat's! We loved the various options available to build our own burger. The fries were fantastic, both garlic and rosemary, as well as the animal fries. We loved the paper burger holders that are provided on the tables allowing you to eat your burger as tidily as can be possible.

My partner and I came here for dinner for an escape from noodles every day and we LOVED it. It's like a Vietnamese version of Five Guys or ShakeShack and building our own burgers was great and also cheap. Theres loads of options of what to put inside your burger/sauces/patty/bun as well. Great service and cute little location too. Also, if you visit here, get the rosemary and garlic fries!!! Would recommend for sure!

Service was good. Food was delicious. Burgers can be customized, or picked from a list of Signature selections. Vegetarians and vegans will have options. A meal for two with a shared desert (we couldn√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t fit more into our tummies) and 2 non-alcoholic beverages set us back around VND 450K. Go check it out if you like your burgers and fries.

address: 65/52 To Ngoc Van Front of the lake, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Tapasbar, spanish food.
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: The bar is well placed in a quiet neighborhood. Still suffering the aftermath of the pandemic, need some refurbishment to offer such an Spaniard atmosphere, as the name suggests. Not much customers when we dropped by, Saturday noon. Dishes are small but tasty and well seasoned, bread is outstanding and his owner Rodrigo is a nice guy and used to be around and keeping an eye on everything.

This made a nice change from local cuisine and was a treat. We ordered way too much food but is was all delicious, if ordering a meat platter this comes with bread already so best not to order more bread on the side as you end up with like a loaf, same with the alioli dip, pretty much everything came with this so ordering a side was unnecessary. The Spanish omelette was tasty, cheeae empnadias and mushroom croqueetes were good too. All of the food came out together and well presented, we just know to order less next time! The staff were super friendly and welcoming here also

Great value for money and tasty food. Generous portions. Potatoes a bit too oily. Service staff look depressed, no smile and walking around very sad...owners must be in kitchen but service team need to cheer up.

name: 21gam of Hanoi
address: 26 Tr∆∞∆°ng H√°n Si√™u, Ho√†n Ki·∫øm, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Located on Truong Han Sieu street, which is neither long nor short, noisy during the day and quiet at night, the old house with red paint of 21GAM is like a different world as soon as you step in. Just behind a door, there is a space filled with music, the sound of a lively crowd, and the clinking of glasses from the bartenders who are busy mixing drinks behind the bar‚Ä¶ All these will captivate you, occupy all your senses, and make you forget about life outside. That explains why 21GAM is one of the most popular nightlife spots for Hanoians, and tourists seem to also agree with that. Hey, if you have 8 hours of work in the office, a busy day with meetings and unfinished deadlines, a little hectic life, then let 21GAM soothe your soul
example_reviews: I like the old fashioned. My wife got too many of the signature cocktails and she ran away with another man. I am currently trying to sway her back by brooding at the bar. No amount of cologne has helped.

Classy atmosphere but with great energy. Went with my friends and we had such a fun night. If you are looking for an elegant and unique space (favorite design choice: the giant amber egg hanging overhead) and like grooving along to music from the DJ, it‚Äôs a must-try. The space feels cozy and lively. Enjoyable for many age groups.

I went there with my best friends and had a great time. I love the ambience, decoration was impressive. The staffs were very nice and supportive. They managed to give us 2 seat without prior reservation. Overall a very nice experience!

name: The Taj - Indian Restaurant & Bar
address: 71 Hang Buom, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Welcome to "The Taj" a culinary oasis in the heart of Hanoi, where the essence of India meets the energy of the Vietnamese capital. Named after the iconic Taj Mahal, our restaurant offers a modern twist on traditional Indian cuisine. At The Taj, experience a harmonious blend of authentic flavors and contemporary flair.Our menu showcases culinary masterpieces that transport you through the diverse landscapes of India. Whether you are a connoisseur or a newcomer to Indian cuisine, The Taj promises a delightful journey for your taste buds. Join us at The Taj for an unforgettable dining experience, where the spirit of India converges with the heart of Vietnam. Welcome to a place where every dish is a celebration of flavor and tradition.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Fast Food Restaurants in Hoan Kiem
Pizza for Lunch in Hoan Kiem
Seafood Restaurants for Lunch in Hoan Kiem
example_reviews: Great little find when we were out walking last night. The food was fresh and tasty for a great price. Service was excellent. We ordered a rice each and nan to share which was a mistake as one portion of rice was big enough for two of us and the nans were individual sized. We would recommend the chicken tikka masala. Will definitely go back before we go home.

Wow, our meal here was absolutely delicious!! We ate the best butter chicken and garlic naan we have ever had!!! Rich and creamy sauce, tender fresh chicken and authentic spices and flavour!!! The rice was perfect and fluffy and the garlic naan was out of this world - cooked perfectly with the freshest garlic embedded in the bread and the dipping sauces took it all to the next level! The restaurant is just around the corner from Hanoi Beer St in the old quarter so a fantastic, vibrant area to wander through. The atmosphere inside and out was great! You can choose to sit outside or inside, ground floor or upstairs where the aircon was perfectly cool! A very high quality yet affordable meal (and drinks) with great service from lovely Indian and Vietnamese staff! If you feel like a change from Vietnamese food on your trip, this is a must try!!!

YOU can‚Äôt Go Wrong with The Taj Indian and Vegetarian Restaurant. We started with the samosas which were flaky and not greasy. Nans were like pastry with a good selection of fillings. The vegetable masala was spicy deliciousness, and the spinach was smooth and flavorful. Mahdab, the owner was delightfully friendly and attentive. Priced and portioned for families. I highly recommend a visit at least once during your stay in the Old Quarter, Hanoi. It‚Äôs also on a street that is bustling with all sorts of candies, nuts and bottled booze! ENJOY ‚ò∫Ô∏è

name: Cinebar Cocktail & Wine
address: 41 Hang Bai, Hoan Kiem 2nd Floor, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Every corner in has a way to speak to all movie and music lovers out there. The most special thing in Cinerbar is the bar which imitates ticket-selling counters in movie theatres, and a screen showing teasers. When you look around, the bar surrounds you with a vintage atmosphere with its warm dark colours, classic movie posters, and vinyl records. One couldn‚Äôt help but feel a little nostalgic. You can pick a seat at the ‚Äúticket-selling‚Äù bar, or at the rows of red sofas to enjoy your drinks of choice in this cinema-inspired space.

example_reviews: Cinebar is one of the top cooktails in Hanoi, located near by Hoan Kiem lake. Excellent live music every friday. Good spot fora date or chilling with friends

Great cocktail bar. The bartenders take great care making the drinks and also checked to make sure we were happy with them after we‚Äôd had a few minutes to taste them. Planning to go back again soon!

Really nice bar tucked away up a stairs. You could so easily walk by it and not even know it‚Äôs there! The bartenders were very attentive and we had a lovely chat, giving us great recommendations for our travels. I tried the 500 days of summer cocktail, I would really recommend it.

khang is one of my favourite Japanese restaurant in town. could'nt remember when was my first time there back in early 90s of the last century√∞≈∏Àú‚Ç¨. You would find the Japanese family style restaurant. menu is extensive and I guess there are not few chinese or vietnamese mixed disks. the modest lunch sets for single customers are very popular. the foods are generally good. sashimis are quite fresh, mostly from local fish. the prices are on the above average side. the shop looks small outside but quite big inside and very busy at lunch time. better book your table in advance. note that all shoes off entering the shop. name: Hoa Sua Training Restaurant
address: No 2A, Hang Chuoi Alley Pham Dinh Ho, Hai Ba Trung, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Hoa Sua is an organization that is designed to give disadvantaged youth life and vocational training skills. Hoa Sua's Training Resturaunt gives it's students a place to learn and deliver an excellent customer dining experience. Our students serve great Vietnamese and French cuisine in an elegant setting.
cuisines: Eastern European Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: We loved the Idea of this Cafe. It is for people with mental health problems.. The all learn English and work to serve people like us that stop and visit. The sevice was good and the cocktails and food were really good.

What a cool place! This place trains young Vietnamese kids and prepares them for a career in the restaurant industry. The kids were really engaged and excited. The food was really tasty and well-presented. I really enjoyed my lemongrass chicken and banana flower salad.

Wonderful cooking class at Hao Sua, a vocational school designed to teach teens from poor villages a trade (sewing, embroidery, French cooking, Vietnamese cooking, baking, table service) then places them in local restaurants and hotels post-graduation. Started the day at the local market. Fresh vegetables, spices and meat. Seeing chickens in a cage was bothersome for my 13 year old son and my husband made sure he didn‚Äôt see chickens being killed. In retrospect, we should have asked our guide to avoid the meat section of the market although can‚Äôt get a more authentic experience. The ingredients for our food had already been bought but we picked up some mangosteen and vegetables. After a quick tour of the school, we made our way to the kitchen. Spent the morning making a delicious papaya salad, fresh spring rolls (rolling them perfectly is definitely an art) and grilled chicken. The chef guided us through the prep and cooking process. After we finished, we sat down at a beautifully set table to our feast. One of the best meals we had on our trip thanks to a great chef. Highly recommend this class as family fun and a great way to learn about Vietnamese food.

name: Paolo and chi Italian restaurant
address: 284 Nghi Tam Street Yen Phu Ward, Tay Ho district, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Paolo and Chi is located at 284 Nghi tam, a main street of Yen Phu, Tay Ho. We are a family owned operated business and offer a dine in, take out and delivery all day long to late night. We have always given the people excellent "home cooked" food as well as fast delivery and friendly customer service, all at a palatable price. Our pizza, pasta, salad and meat are prepared fresh daily in our kitchen and that is our guarantee
cuisines: Late Night Mexican Restaurants in Hanoi
Late Night Middle Eastern Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: We ordered from this place a number of times while we were in lock-down for COVID. The food was so good that I really wanted to visit and eat in the restaurant itself. The ambiance isn't much. The dining room is quite small and because it's all concrete, the loud party next to us was quite annoying. And, we saw some of the kitchen staff smoking in the kitchen. Perhaps that's OK in Vietnam but for a westerner, it's a bit of a turn-off. Either way, the food was good. Yes, most of my friends prefer Pizza Belga but I find Belga to be overpriced and "under-cheesed" if that's a word. We actually really enjoyed everything we got from Paolo and I hope to return soon.
We had a late dinner cause we couldn't find anything else but we were surprised by the prices,food and staff, everything was good,the restaurant is clean,wasn't too crowded when we got there
This place is quite expensive, so because of that we probably wouldn't order with them again. But the food was ok, nothing special, just average.

name: Ramen Iroha
address: 25 Duong Thanh Hoan Kiem District, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description:
Was really craving a good ramen and wanted to try a new spot in Hanoi and after googling best Ramen in Hanoi this spot popped up.

Trust me you won't be disappointed. The ramen was AMAZING, and the BEST part was the pork was roasted instead of boiled.

More importantly, the service was INCREDIBLE. Our waitress was extremely polite, friendly and attentive, one of the best waitresses I've ever seen.

Definitely try out this spot when you have the chance.
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Was really craving a good ramen and wanted to try a new spot in Hanoi and after googling best Ramen in Hanoi this spot popped up. Trust me you won't be disappointed. The ramen was AMAZING, and the BEST part was the pork was roasted instead of boiled. More importantly, the service was INCREDIBLE. Our waitress was extremely polite, friendly and attentive, one of the best waitresses I've ever seen. Definitely try out this spot when you have the chance.

we eventually got to try Iroha ramen after they opened again after being closed over the recent Tet new year celebrations and it was definitely worth the wait. One of my favourite restaurant dishes is Ramen and having tasted ramen in 5 of the 7 continents I certainly rate Iroha up there with some of the best outside of Japan. The broth was both flavoursome and not too salty, with a nice selection of ingredients. This is a highly recommended ramen restaurant.

Was looking for a quality ramen üçú place in Hanoi and stumbled upon Iroha after looking it up. Arrived right after they re-opened for the dinner service, so had the place entirely to myself. The staff were second to none and they were extremely attentive and courteous. Food-wise, I went for the Miso Ramen, which was as good a bowl I could have hoped for. Noodles were spot-on, broth was great, the pork slices were tender and flavorful, and the egg yolk was just as it should be with a gorgeous consistency. Price was a bit high by local standards, but well-worth it if you‚Äôre craving the good stuff like it is back in Japan. As someone who lives in this city, I‚Äôll definitely come back for more.

Is is definitely an upper class Vietnamese food for sure but the quality is guaranteed! Love the pomelo salad as I always look forward it. The fried squid looks like chrysanthemum flower rather bland inside but with the special prepared dipping sauce , pretty good. The grilled chicken thigh with fried rice cake! Rather bland for the chicken meat for sure and need more marination ! The rice cake is great and brought me back to my nostalgia time that my grandma prepared for us ! The decor is very traditional Vietnamese setting and service is great..!

example_reviews: We happened to walk by this place and thought we saw a sign for Che Thai (Thai fruit dessert) so we came in. Turned out they didn‚Äôt have it. But we‚Äôre glad we sat down because the coffee is sooo good! Dark and strong and sweet, what real Viet coffee should taste like. I think this is more of a local spot, but if you want strong Viet coffee this is one of the spots to check out (they don‚Äôt have egg coffee though, but quite a selection of drinks and dessert drinks. And it‚Äôs at a busy intersection so you can sit and enjoy the traffic and people watching.
Got to the nearest AHA cafe to get am fix and was not disappointed. The straight black without any sweetening energised me immediately!

Mango smoothie was delicious, but the service forces rather bored. Wie sat in the 1. floor and have watched the bustle on the road junction. Unfortunately, the waiter was told that he was quite unmotivated. But our mango smoothie was very delicious

address: 60 Giang Van Minh Ba Dinh, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: The service was great and the staff were super friendly. Tons of mushrooms to try! Just a heads-up: the beef wasn‚Äôt super fresh and the hotpot felt a bit oily and salty.
example_reviews: The service was great and the staff were super friendly. Tons of mushrooms to try! Just a heads-up: the beef wasn‚Äôt super fresh and the hotpot felt a bit oily and salty.

My father and I had dinner at Ashima tonight (16th Jan 2019) and I can honestly say this was a breath taking experience. We are foodies and know are food. The quality of the fresh ingredients (morilles and cepes mushrooms, Japanese wagyu beef etc) was just outstanding. We were brought a whole plate of fresh morilles which are extremely expensive. We were amazed by the profusion of high quality ingredients specially in such quantities for each customer. The resulting hotpot was... Well... The best I have ever had. It was not cheap but certainly worth more than we were charged. Highly recommended
The dishes that this restaurant have were very tasty and I really enjoyed eating the mushroom and the noodles.

name: Tomato Seafood
address: 33 Nguyen Thi Dinh Street Trung Hoa, Cau Giay District, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Fresh seafood everyday, in a clean and modern restaurant with reasonable price and friendly staffs. This seafood restaurant brand has 2 locations in town: 82 Le Van Huu, Hoan Kiem & 33 Nguyen Thi Dinh, Cau Giay.
cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Delicious food (grilled oysters with cheese, garlic butter snails, jellyfish salad, gourd crab hotpot), enthusiastic service. Yummy. This is the 5th time eating at this restaurant.
The seafood at this place is really nice, especially the fried seafood noodle and egged squid. It's a shame I was the only one enjoying it. I definitely plan to come back with a group next time.

My husband and I had a fabulous seafood dinner at this restaurant during our visit to Hanoi last week. The staff did not speak much English but they were friendly and helpful. We had 2 seafood dishes, the crab in sour sauce and mantis shrimp with garlic and butter and both dishes were excellent. Sauteed morning glory and seafood with glass noodle were both also very tasty. The best part was that they had a promotion for week night dining which made the meal very reasonable (even our tour guide thought so). This restaurant is located a bit away from the main tourist area in the old quarter but definitely worth the trip to get there.

name: Tannin Wine Bar
address: 46 Hang Vai, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: A few things to know about Tannin Wine Bar - A cozy, international, specialized wine bar in the heart of Hanoi - Over 500 wines listed and in stock - Old World & New World fully represented to suit all budgets - Curated list of 10 wines by the glass, from entry level to premium - try something new! Changes every 2 weeks - A nice range of premium spirits, digestifs & aperitifs - Relaxed, cozy atmosphere with good music and professional but friendly service - Delicious dishes, charcuterie, cheese boards and our great breads to go with your wines - Main bar, also with back room for groups, and our mezzanine wine cellar overlooking the bar - Tannin was opened by a team of wine professionals and long-term Hanoi residents from France, Vietnam, and the UK - a place built as somewhere we wanted to spend time in and we hope that you enjoy as well! - Convenient central location on a quiet, classic Hanoi street on the edge of the Old Quarter with plenty of parking.
cuisines: Pizza with Private Dining in Hanoi
Seafood Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
example_reviews: Lovely little place in Hanoi - a place with a sophisticated European feel in the hustle & bustle of Hanoi Old Town. We visited a couple of times, once on a Wednesday which is Jazz night - beautiful soft jazz, not too loud, gave the place a lovely atmosphere. Would recommend if in Hanoi Old town - good wines, & though not extensive, the menu has a good selection - can certainly recommend the cheese board. Hope it continues to thrive!

Nice wine bar with a very good selection of wines, delicious cheese and very fresh, crispy baguettes. The music is tailored to European tastes and fits perfectly in this bar. Everything is very pleasant and atmospheric. The bubbling sound with which mucus is drawn up from the nose into the throat is certainly not one of the more pleasant acoustic experiences. Unfortunately, the young bartender doesn't know this and is constantly busy with his slime, which is especially disgusting when you are eating. Unfortunately, the staff is not very friendly to the guests. We were here practically every evening during our stay in Hanoi and the behavior hasn't changed. It's a shame, we would expect that at this price level and in a bar that is obviously aimed at European customers.

This is a proper wine bar in Hanoi. A range of red and white wines by the glass and an extensive wine by the bottle list. Happy hour 4pm to 7 pm with 30% reduction was sadly missed by us but fir top quality wines this is still a great venue The cheese plate was substantial and will be easily sufficient for two Don‚Äôt miss Ajax Wednesday. Soft mellow jazz beautifully song and played by two local musicians. Overall this is a place to plan into any trip to Hanoi

This is a great spot for some pretty amazing Thai food.  It's nicely presented, and there's a few stories to there's a bit of room (although it seems to be popular with office lunches so it can be a bit raucous).  

The food was amazing.  We over ordered with grilled chicken and fishcakes, followed by half a baked fish and some very good Thai red curry.  It was all cooked perfectly.

Service is great, Tiger beer was cold and the flavours authentic.  Well worth a look if you're in the area.

My recent visit to Thuy Ta Cafe on the banks of Hoan Kiem Lake in Hanoi was a mixed experience. The picturesque lakeside setting and view of Hoan Kiem Lake were certainly major draws for this property. The quality of drinks and food was acceptable, but not exceptional. However, the main negative was the price. I found that the prices were a little too high compared to the quality of the products offered. It's important to note that prices shown on the card do not include taxes and service fees, which may result in a final bill that is higher than expected. The service at Thuy Ta cafe was OK, but not particularly attentive. I would have appreciated an additional touch of friendliness to make the experience more pleasant. Despite these drawbacks, the lakeside location was lovely, and the place was conducive to relaxation. It's a nice place to have a coffee or a snack while enjoying the beautiful view of the lake.
Beside good service and tasty vietnamese food, this restaurant is ‚Äúmust visit‚Äù place in Hanoi due to its location! I love the view toward Hoan Kiem Lake! Amazing

WLS is your new place to enjoy craft beers, craft food & great selection of wines around the pool table or simply in our garden. Enjoy our fresh pizza cooking in real wood oven pizza... If you like the typical Bistrot you will appreciate the new talent and the delicate touch of our French Chef Morgane and the typical design of the different Bistrot and Estaminet from France. Find also a great selections for the veggie fans on menu or in daily specials... Come to visit us shortly, and enjoy WestLake Station day and night.

example_reviews: This is a decent spot for food and drinks. They have seating in the patio and also Air-Conditioned seating upstairs if you want to escape the Hanoi summer. Interesting and fun place.. A pool table for added fun. There‚Äôs plenty of space to sit outside surrounded with greenery. We had pizza & fries which were tasty.

This place was a great find whilst here in Hanoi with my work for 6 weeks. Thursday nights they do mussels in a fantastic tomato and garlic baste - very tasty. They do wood fired pizzas and various other foods, which are delicious. Not local Viet food, but not over priced either. Very friendly team there and always happy to help. We went on Thursday night 19/12 for mussels. Last night for pizza and beers. We will be back tonight again.

name: OAK Wine Boutique

description: This little wine bar is a must do in old Hanoi. Nestled above the street, walking distance from Hoan Kiem lake, they have an extensive, yet reasonably priced selection of wines and some simple, but fabulous dishes. We sat out on the balcony and watched the city drift past! The staff were incredibly friendly, and you would be hard pressed to have better warm fresh bread and butter in all on Vietnam (or France for that matter)! Definitely recommend giving this place a try!

example_reviews: This restaurant was very close to our hotel and was a perfect location for a light evening meal prior to a massage. All plates were well presented and were great examples of popular local dishes. Beers and wines are also available and all at very reasonable prices.

and definitely the best in Hanoi. Charming local family owned restaurant, master chef selects best local ingredients and you can taste it. has an upstairs patio where you can enjoy a Hanoi beer and watch the disarray of scooters and shoppers below
Very good place, ideal for solo travellers looking for good meal, local flavor, while on the way. No frills, just good food nice and peaceful place,

EXCELLENT thank you Hieu and the team! This is a must, the food was very tasty. Pizza and pasta, great ingredients fresh. Great service great atmosphere and staff! If you fancy a change this is a must!! We need to up the reviews here!
Great pizza! We had the 4 cheese & the capriciosa. The 4 cheese was a little sickly due to being a purely white base but overall very yummy

German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: There are hundreds of bars selling cheap beer in Hanoi. However, if you are after higher quality beers and drinks, still well priced, you really should make your way to this excellent small place in central Hanoi. Friendly owner and staff help make this new bar a really pleasant place to chill.

We came in for an afternoon beer but little did we know that we would enjoy a genuine chat and amazing experience. Stephen (owner) shared his captivating story with us along side the best beer in Vietnam! Highly recommend for everyone!

Great cosy bar. Really welcoming owner and staff with fantastic knowledge of the wide range of beers and wine on offer. Told us the story behind the beers we had. Just sad we only found it on our last night!

name: Lamai Garden
address: 36B ƒê√™ Quai, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description:
The couple wants to be quiet, enjoy delicious food, share happy and sad stories about their children or work... Or find a simple place to sit and meditate, listen to Le Cat Trong Ly's music, enjoy Vietnamese food but Cooked and presented in a minimalist style but not boring.
The arrangement of the dishes and the order are all intentional by the chef.
I'm the type that can eat anything, but with the message the chef conveys through every detail and flavor, the feeling of last night's dinner is like a gentle, deep song but filled and filled with happiness, laughter and joy. understanding.

This is suitable for dating for parents, after many days of hard work taking care of grandparents and children, they deserve to sit there, make funny flirtatious jokes and enjoy delicious food, fragrant wine and reminders. about our difficult but exciting journey together.

This is an amazing experience in a special place that looks more like a living room than a commercial restaurant. 10 minutes taxi ride from the old city, this is a residential area and the restaurant is hided behing a wall that conceals a beautiful garden and villa. We sat at the bar which allows for full view of what happens in the open kitchen. The tasting menu is balanced, very special and based on local produce and Vietnamese ingredients. Everything was so beautifully presented and the taste was always subtle and yet exciting. The price is also friendly for what you get so it is a highly recommended experience when in Hanoi. DONT MISS IT !

Lamai Garden Restaurant in Hanoi is a delightful place for dinner. They specialize in authentic Vietnamese cuisine, and the dishes are full of flavor and freshness. The cozy atmosphere and attentive service make it a top choice for an authentic dining experience in the city.

name: Coffee 24
address: 24 Bat Dan Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 110802 Vietnam
description: This is a local coffee shop in the Old Quarter in Ha Noi with very cheap price. There are some kind of local coffee such as : coffee with milk, black coffee etc... Beside that, local fast food is one of the most delicious food in my restaurant like : Bread with pate,with egg,grill meat... It costs only from 1$ to 5$/ person. Come to us to enjoy a part of local lifestyle of Vietnamese.
example_reviews: Visited this centrally located caf√© in Hanoi and the prices are very cheap, between 30,000 and 40,000 ish for a banh mi. We also ordered a very nice coffee (25,000) and a mango smoothie (40,000) and both were delicious. Staff are very friendly and the food is so good - highly recommend.
Beef pho was delicious and so cheap 50k dong!! We also asked for vegetable egg fried rice which they did and was big portion 50k done also. Nice cheap eat place, not to much on the menu though!

This is a wonderful place. You feel welcome. The lady is taking care very well of all her clients . It's such a pleasure to have drinks, tea, coffee, coconut water on this little terrace in the fans breeze. I love to stop here every day. üòÅ

name: Pepperonis
address: 98 Hang Trong Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description:
After a morning of sight-seeing, we were looking for an "easy" lunch, and Pepperonis (right next to the Oriental Jade Hotel where we were staying) was both convenient and offered a familiar western-style menu.  I ordered the lunch special offered that day (salad bar, pizza, pasta, 145,000 VND) but misunderstood that apparently both a small pizza and a small portion of pasta was included; as I declined the pizza I received a double portion of pasta.  Had I ordered both the pizza and pasta, it would have been far too much food.  The salad bar was incompletely stocked at 1:30 PM but what I found was good.  The "spaghetti bolognaise" didn't taste a bit like what you'd find in Italy and had a tomato-based sauce that resembled what would come from a bottle of Ragu.  My partner had a BBQ beef pizza that was "okay."  The total bill with two bottled waters was 387,720 VND (about $16).

Despite only an average experience at lunch, the easy option appealed to us again several days later for dinner.  We split a large Hawaiian pizza that was good but not great.  With three local beers, the charge was 337,000 VND (about $14).  Service for both meals was good but not polished.  We sensed tension between the wait staff and their manager.

The menu is extensive and extends far beyond pasta and pizza.  The other diners were mostly local, and at dinner included families enjoying huge platters of ribs and other western items.  I found the experience at Pepperonis to be like going to Denny's in the USA.  Never great, but it gets the job done.

I found the experience at Pepperonis to be like going to Denny's in the USA. Never great, but it gets the job done.

Located between the Hanoi Cathedral and our Minerva Premium Hotel, we saw that the menu out front had lots of salads and pizzas and then noticed all the Asian customers. On our 1st visit, we enjoyed Avocado salad with shrimp, Lime drink and Brownie with ice cream. The 2nd visit, we ordered the large split(Hawaiian/Marinara) thin crust pizza, Lime Drink, Zero Heiniken, then caramel dessert and apple crisp with ice cream. Excellent food and service with both bills under $19. Noise level is high especially with families on the weekends.

Decent place for a quick pizza dinner. We had the family combo with a large pepperoni pizza, six ribs, garlic bread and an Australian sausage. About what we expected for a pizza in this area of Hanoi.

name: Madam Tu Hong
address: 5 Hoi Vu Alley, Hoan Kiem District, Hanoi, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description:
We had the best Cha Ca at Madame Tu Hongs restaurant. We stumbled on it down a back alley behind our hotel, the Beryl Charm Hotel and did we ever luck out. 

We ordered fresh spring rolls and they were delicious. We then ordered the Cha Ca and they brought out a plate of vermicelli and a tray with peanuts, chili üå∂Ô∏è peppers as a topping. A young man cooked the vegetables and fish at our table. We put the vermicelli in a bowl followed by the vegetables and fish and topped it with a fresh shrimp paste.  It had to be one of the most delicious meals we have had in Vietnam. The vegetables and fish were so fresh and the mixture of the shrimp paste with the fish was sublime. 

If only we could go again we certainly would. The price point was very affordable for any budget.

Vietnamese Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi

The cha ca was amazing. I am normally not a big fan of shrimp paste, but this restaurant knows how to make it easy for first-timers like me to give it a try. I changed to fish sauce after but overall it was great.

This place is one of the best and nicest restaurants I have been to in Hanoi. Super friendly staff, super delicious food, super great ambiance and the price is perfect. Complete value for money. 10/10. No complaints. 100% recommend.

name: Thang Tran Quan
address: 14 Hang Ca Street 14 Hang Ca Street - 14 Cha Ca Street, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam

cuisines: Japanese Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
Late Night Mediterranean Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: Really great place. We came here by a group of 4 hugry people after 8h of walking around city and we recived even to much food to eat all of it. Prices are really fair, from my point of view, and personel is really friendly. Only one thing to notice - noodles = soup, but it was great, so who cares XD

We went twice it was that good, owner is so so so lovely gave us free bananas as dessert. Food was great, we had the steamed chicken both times it was that delicious. Good prices too compared to similar places around the old quarter and very generous portions. Cafe is small and cozy sealed off from the busy road so less noise, good air con, very clean. In summary just eat all your meals in Hanoi here

We had walked around trying to find a small cafe restaurant that wasn‚Äôt eating on the side of the road. They were friendly, good the best we had whilst on our stay in Hanoi and with wifi and a good fan, it was perfect. We ate bbq pork and seafood dishes with noodles
