example_reviews: Coming with few friends to Anbien, feeling Hai Phong's breeze. Such a cozy and simple nice decor restaurant.
Nice small but very clean restaurant's the food was very tasty and cheap compared with other restaurants in the area. Very local cuisine and they have some English speaking waiters

I really like to enjoy meal here. All foods are famous-street-foods of HaiPhong. Taste is delicious with nice decoration. Variety selections are from low to high prices and suitable for slight to main meal, for single to family with kids. Restaurant is quite clean with feeling cozy. Highly recommended for family with kids because restaurant has Air Con and of course, that is the best thing we wish in summer of Vietnam :)

example_reviews: Great food with amazing service. They make westerners feel at home. Our servers were great and the quality and value were outstanding.
Romantic, cozy & beautiful! Perfect for groups or date nights- wine quality is excellent-they do offer a happy hour as well from 4-8pm Staff is friendly and attentive, prices reasonable too!

5 minute walk from both the Sheraton and Intercontinental hotels. The food quality, selection, and presentation are excellent. The prices are extremely reasonable. We started with duck pate matched with a variety of breads. We were served an amuse b√ªche of beef relish. Hummus was provided to go with the bread baskets. I ordered a set menu of spring rolls, duck confit, and cr√®me br√ªl√©e. My partner ordered the fish and panna cotta. We loved everything. They have an extensive wine cellar, VERY reasonably priced. The meal was excellent and the staff were very attentive and engaging with a good command of English. The decor is beautiful - brick walls with a selection of modern paintings. We had a table by a very large window so we could watch Hanoi nightlife while we ate. I recommend the Vine to anybody staying in the area.

example_reviews: I chose from the a la carte menu: 1 soup, 1 salad and 1 wagu beef steak. The steak is really impressive, soft and delicious, and the degree of doneness is just right. Polite and enthusiastic service, price is about 100 USD/person including mineral water and beer. Highly recommend üëç

We stayed at the Pan Pacific Hanoi from the 23rd Dec 2019 to the 30th Dec 2019. We had breakfast at the place for about 3 times and the rest we upgraded to the club house. The spread of the food is large and they have nice healthy freshly blended fruits and vegetable juices too.

I have never encountered a better buffet! Vietnamese, Korean, Japanese, American and other cuisines too numerous to mention. The choices are overwhelming and uniformly delicious! Located off the lobby of the Pan Pacific hotel, the Pacifica can‚Äôt be beat!

If ever you happen to pick this place for dinner, I hope you enjoy the view and have a wonderful conversation with Kelvin and Cantus.

We had thr pleasure to be sreved by Kelvin and Cantus for our dinner. They're attentive, knowledgeable, and very kind. The food is also delicious, great value for money. The place is nice and clean, with a great view of the lake. Highly recommend!
Good hospitality, good food. We spent here for 10 days and were happy with the restaurant. Hospitality, service and friendliness of Thong FBM, Hung, Thanh and Duc Anh, Keep up your good work.

example_reviews: The restaurant is spacious, clean, the food is delicious and the staff is enthusiastic. I will come back and support. Service staff are enthusiastic and friendly. The restaurant is decorated very beautifully, reasonably, modernly, and luxuriously.

I visited the branch in Hanoi for a quick lunchtime snack and I sat at the bar. The atmosphere was decent, probably very cool for a romantic nighttime meal. Prices are relatively high for such in Hanoi but compared to Western prices it is pretty cheap. Food quality is good and fresh. I personally like the chefs to wear gloves so that their skin does not touch my raw fish, although I am well aware of the for and agains on this.... Still, if you like the gloves ON this is not necessarily the place for you. They bring very small amounts of ginger and they served no wasabi which I thought a tad strange, although to be fair - when I asked they did bring what I needed very fast. Services is distant but decent. The place is worth a visit.

Was there with my family twice in January 2017 and May 2017. The ambiance was great and the service was decent. The food was alright, nothing spectacular though. To sum it up, the quality of the food does not match the price and I think there are better Japanese places to put your money.

You can find all kind of fresh & delicous seafood dishes cooked with Vietnamese-style here. This restaurant is really my favourite for the weekend!

name: Gecko Cafe
address: 2 Hang Bong Hang Gai, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Big menu with traditional options and western options. I had the creamy chicken and corn soup and my partner had the stir-fry beef. Both meals were yum and my partner ended up with a bonus because of happy hour - 2 for 1 beers, so that was a nice surprise when it arrived. Meals are reasonably priced our bill was around the 280,000 mark for 2 drinks + a freebie, 2 meals and an appetiser. Staff were friendly and the venue is clean and quirky.
cuisines: Late Night Sushi Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: Big menu with traditional options and western options. I had the creamy chicken and corn soup and my partner had the stir-fry beef. Both meals were yum and my partner ended up with a bonus because of happy hour - 2 for 1 beers, so that was a nice surprise when it arrived. Meals are reasonably priced our bill was around the 280,000 mark for 2 drinks + a freebie, 2 meals and an appetiser. Staff were friendly and the venue is clean and quirky.

Got back to Hanoi late after a day trip and the restaurant we wanted to eat at was closed. Walked around the corner and found Gecko. It's a find! I think I had ribs with mashed potato (of all things!) and the potato was the best I had ever tasted, really! My friends had a rice dish and a noodle dish which were all really tasty and the cost was amazingly low. We had beers too. Sadly it was our last night in Hanoi or we would have returned to sample the other dishes on the menu. The staff were friendly and the delivery of the dishes was prompt. Really great place to eat in Hanoi, and easily found.

I had the chicken and sweetcorn soup which was nice and creamy, although it didnt come with bread so had to pay extra for that. My boyfriend ordered meatballs which came with rice, the sauce was more like sweet and sour rather than tomato sauce and he found it too sugary and salty so didnt eat much. We both enjoyed our shakes though.

I would most certainly recommend this restaurant for those seeking an alternative cuisine in Hanoi!

We been there before on normal days they serve the dimsum in the chinese restaurant. This time we went for their buffet Dimsum and they have alot more choices spread over the open area on 2nd floor. They serve and go around using the traditional carts and the food quality is still good! Will definitely be back again.
One of my favourite place for lunch during Sunday. They have quite a selection of dimsum items with the traditional carts going around. The price is pretty reasonable compare to Crystal Jade.

name: Nguyen Van Duc Snake Restaurant
address: No.4 Alley 82 Le Mat Street, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description:
My friend - Elliot and his girlfriend from Norway suggested to try snake meat. We came to this restaurant last Wednesday from 6pm. It is lucky for us because the price of cobra and bamboo snake is same this time. We decided to choose 1-kg-cobra for 3 persons. They serve 11 dishes of cobra, it is amazing. 
Can you believe that the heart of cobra is still-beating when got out of its body. 
My friends like to drink blood of cobra mixed with vodka.

Right from the entrance one is made welcome and relaxed. Was introduced to available snakes. The cobra supposidely tastier is much bigger enough for several people. I chose the Bamboo snake small enough for one person. You get to see the culling including swollowing the beating heart infused in snake blood Vodka. Several shots of that and the eight course meal kept coming. Couldn't eat the whole thing but a worthwhile Experince 3.5 for me

We just wandered here on our own a little after lunch time as the last of the customers were leaving and staff had already started cleaning yet they were ready to serve us. There was a lone English speaking staff who explained the process. We opted for a cobra which was cooked into 10 different dishes. The blood n bile were mixed with rice wine to have as shots. Food was tasty and service was ok. The only thing amiss was the heart was not still beating when being served. A little tricky to find. We booked an uber and asked the staff to explain the address. The uber guy cancelled - the reason could be the alleys or maybe the staff wanted to arrange their transporation...finally we walked out onto the main street and booked another uber.

example_reviews: This beautiful place reminds me of the old Hanoi Old Quarter. I ate grilled pork rolls on bamboo sticks, it was very delicious. Different from other restaurants I've eaten at. Today I'm not hungry enough to eat crab spring rolls. Next time I'll stop by to eat crab spring rolls and shrimp cakes.

We were recommended this restaurant by a friend and was definitely not disappointed. The owner was a lovely lady who took great pride in her food. We had a mixed plate of Combo Buncha +crab spring roll (to die for) +shrimp cake and tea. Excellent value and we would recommend you to come here
Best food in Vietnam. Absolutely spectacular!! Right on a busy street, but while you‚Äôre eating, you don‚Äôt hear a thing, because it‚Äôs all about the food!! Will be back for sure! YUM

name: Nan n Kabab Halal Restaurant
address: 34 Lo Ren Street Hang Bo Ward Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Nan n Kabab Halal Restaurant Opened 2nd Branch In Heart Of Hanoi Old Quarter. Welcome our new branch wide sitting area. Artistic embience .

example_reviews: Amazing and delicious food at Nan n Kabab. The staff and owner so helpful and very kind. Quantity of the food great and restaurant very clean. It‚Äôs not easy to find Halal restaurants in Hanoi and I strongly recommend this hotel whenever you at Hanoi
Nice sitting . Good location in centre Hanoi. So delicous food. Amazing kabab.soft nan, tasty rice and 100% halal food with certificate in hanoi
Loved this place! We wanted some curry and naan fix and we were not left disappointed :) Food was delicious and staff were friendly. Would definitely be back here again when I'm in Hanoi.

address: 44B Ly Thuong Kiet, Hanoi Vietnam
description: MOSAICO is an all-day dining restaurant which provides a casual Mediterranean dining experience in a comfortable space with exquisite decoration. The breakfast buffet with live cooking stations offers a wide range of gourmet delicacies to cater for all tastes. A la carte service is also available throughout the day. Set menu for lunch is available from Monday to Friday.
cuisines: Middle Eastern Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: We stayed at the Melia Hanoi for a week and were surprised by the variety of the breakfast buffet in Mosaic. You can have breakfast any type of meal, even Spanish, everything was very good. It also has a local dishes section. We will certainly repeat
good spot. good variety of well made dishes. the service is very good and the value for money reasonable considering quality
Good food, comfortable seating. Bright and green, not like other hotels in the city. Staff are very friendly and proffesional. Buffet is huge and lots of choices

Delightful and very enjoyable experience. Super authentic flavours. The service is also magnificent. I would highly recommend that you try this restaurant as well as the stay at NESTA hotel.

name: Casa Espa√±a Vietnam
address: Star Tower, Duong Dinh Nghe, Yen Hoa, Cau Giay, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Bringing you a Taste of Spain! Casa Espana is a unique concept combining retail and dining with traditional Spanish fare. Celebrating the beautiful food, wine and culture of contemporary Spain by taking guests on a gastronomic experience through the authentic flavors, spirit and style. A beautiful journey from a selection of Spanish products to the diverse cuisine in the sharing spirit of tapas
cuisines: South American Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: Casa Espa√±a was invited to la Cha√Æne des R√¥tisseurs Vietnam for exemplifying warm customer service, as well as demonstrating ethical business practices. We appreciate Casa Espa√±a‚Äôs casual upscale environment and selection of Spanish and Latin-inspired dishes. #chainedesrotisseurs

We ordered the sous vide rib eye steak . Instead of the blue cheese sauce we asked for black pepper sauce. No problem. We had the best , juicy steak I have had for a long time. It was cooked to perfection - medium rare and the grill marks added extra flavor. Fabulous. It came with some small potatoes and a tiny carrot. A few more vegetables would have been ideal. The white Riojas wine was outstanding. Little acidity. It was quiet in the restaurant that it was easy to talk. Service was excellent. Could not fault. Can recommend

I think "Casa Espana" is the best Spanish restaurant in Hanoi. Lunch set menu (attached photo) was reasonable price and each dishes were very tasty. I tried other set menu as well and they served us cold cuts board, 3 tapas and main dish. If you will go there, I recommend you to drink Barcelona Beer at same time. Enjoyed their food and atmosphere, that's why I give them 5* rating. Thanks Casa Espana.

name: Okii-D Omakase & Teppanyaki Restaurant
address: 62 Bat Su, Hang Bo, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi, Hanoi 11014 Vietnam
description: With experienced chefs in Japanese cuisine, we are confident to be one of the authentic Omakase-style Restaurants in Hanoi. The ingredients in each dish are guaranteed to be fresh and of good quality. Customers can feel themselves through taste as well as sight during the process of enjoying Omakase cuisine. With many years of experience in the industry, we are confident to bring you unique and memorable dining experiences. Our menu doesn't just stop at Sushi and Sashimi but beyond. Okii-D Omakase & Teppanyaki confidently serves all diners even the most fastidious. "Not only delicious and quality food but also a worthwhile experience" - This is something we can confidently promise to every customer.
cuisines: French Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: A very good Japanese restaurant, not for all budgets but so good. Very warm welcome, the cuisine is simply perfect and fresh, the chef explains each dish to you in English. I recommend it, if you like Japanese cuisine, go there with your eyes closed

What an incredible Japanese dinner, an artwork of food. The chefs were precise and thoughtful preparing everything before our eyes with presentation you could only dream of. The master chef went out of his way to describe the dishes and ingredients in his best English too. Many raw fish and egg dishes, exquisite flavours. The staff were attentive. Dinner was fine dining, $300 AUD for two. Our international Mastercard did not work in their eftpos machine and so we then paid cash, but the attitude to the eftpos error (out of our control) was not pleasant for us. An unfortunate end to an incredible experience. I do recommend going but encourage taking cash.

This place was amazing, and not only for the food. We ordered the omakase and were treated to a lavish and elegant feast with over the top presentations of each course. My friend paid for the meal and I paid for a pricey bottle of sake. We couldn‚Äôt finish all the sake but we put enough of a dent in it that I was definitely tipsy by the end of the meal. I meant to leave fifteen dollars over the service charge as tip but mixed up the bills and left $80 instead. I only discovered this when I returned to my hotel. I was annoyed with myself but I didn‚Äôt think there was anything I could do. The next day, I was wandering around Hanoi rather aimlessly and I found myself in front of the restaurant. I thought, why not? And I politely told them I thought I had left too much money the previous night. They immediately said yes, I had. And they promptly returned the money I had given them minus the amount I had intended to tip them. I gave them half that amount again for being so honest and kind. I apologized for my mistake but they assured me it was okay. They have certainly earned the tip, the 5 stars, and my gratitude.

name: Huong Vi Xua
address: Hoa Lan, Vinhomes Riverside Long Bien Dist, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description:
We had a very nice dinner with many variety of dishes.
The restaurant and waiter is very nice.

It is mainly vietnamese food.

example_reviews: We had a very nice dinner with many variety of dishes. The restaurant and waiter is very nice. It is mainly vietnamese food.

this is the restaurant inside vinhomes riverside serving the traditional vietnamese foods all over the nation I was very impressed by the decor and the wait-staff atitude here at first, then the very special food taste. Only the distance between here and the down town is quite far so that we can only be here at our free time But it's still worth a visit some time

I went with my family to visit the restaurant, the space was really great, the food was very good, the staff polite, service very fast and most importantly very clean. Next time I visit Vietnam I will definitely go back to this restaurant p/s: sorry my english is bad

name: Indigo Restaurant
address: 39 Tho Nhuom str Rooftop inside the Acoustic Hotel, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: At Indigo Restaurant, you will enjoy eating exceptional dishes cooked by our talented chefs. Starting from local food to famous western food, you will love it all here inclusive the fresh flavors of our restaurant. Come to enjoy some tasty and rare dishes with us.
example_reviews: First the location of this restaurant is really fantastic view to see the whole old quarter. The place where you can relax after working stressful. Foods were great . I could not say any thing here. The staffs also friendly and nice.

Top food on the 10th floor of the fantastic hotel Acoustic, the service is very friendly and knowledgeable and I would like to say a special thank you to Alice, her enthusiasm is infectious and made us very happy. Greetings Erik

name: Al Fresco's
address: 62 Xuan Dieu Quang An, Tay Ho, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Food was very tasty‚Ä¶ service was quick and good. We had fried Calamari, fried Korean chicken and another chicken cutlet with a cheese topping. The litchi tea was also really nice and refreshing.
example_reviews: Food was very tasty‚Ä¶ service was quick and good. We had fried Calamari, fried Korean chicken and another chicken cutlet with a cheese topping. The litchi tea was also really nice and refreshing.

Excellent quality Western cuisine. Most genuine and well prepared food of all similar restaurants we visited in all of Hanoi. We tried the beef and cheese rolls, beef steak with mushrooms, chef‚Äôs salad, Al Fresco salad, and the chocolate brownie with ice cream. Strongly recommend. Very kind and precise staff with very good understanding of English (unlike some other places).

Delicious pizza! I've eaten at Domino's and Pizza company and found Alfresco's food to be a bit better than the above two restaurants. The space is clean and has a bit of a restaurant feel. There are also often promotions of 99k. Unfortunately, the restaurant doesn't have as many facilities as other pizzerias

name: Countryside Cooking Class & Restaurant
address: 29 Bat Dan Str Old Quarter, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: At Countryside Restaurant & Cooking Class our vision is to become one of Vietnam‚Äôs leading restaurant brands serving modern Vietnamese cuisine with high quality and innovative ideas but never forgetting the roots and value of true and authentic Vietnamese cooking.
example_reviews: Address present on the Routard... Located in old Hanoi... Two well-decorated rooms... Smiling, friendly welcome... Traditional, family-style cuisine and tasty, hearty dishes... Very reasonable prices (< ‚Ç¨50 for 8 people)... We had lunch then dinner in this restaurant (offer - 10% on the second visit).

Food came very quick, ingredients were clearly fresh and dish as a whole was great. Portion size was good also. We along with all the other tables were given some free watermelon afyer our food. Staff were friendly and spoke great English. Good vegetarian options aswell.

We had a tasty hot pot here for a good price (550k vnd) and it was a lot of food for two people. The atmosphere of the restaurant is nice and the staff is efficient and friendly. Definitely worth stopping by for a dinner!

name: Culina dining
address: 142 Tu Hoa Quang An, Tay Ho, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam

example_reviews: Came here for a social group gathering as it was arranged for the group to have twas and coffees upstairs. This was my first visit and the restaurant is delightful, very well decorated and welcoming staff. We were fortunate enough to have a welcome from the restaurant manager who clearly has a high passion for his work and in particular tea, will be returning for a tea tasting session for sure. The upstairs had a large open patio balcony area and was very chic in design. You could also peel at the open kitchen as you walked down to the ground floor. Looking forward to returning

Enjoyable dinner time alone. Very friendly waiter always with warm smile on face. Also introduce the better view on roof top, but a abit hot for me eventually i stayed indoor. Great local place with a modern menu. Seasonal specials too. Upstairs for the lunch and dinner menus. Downstairs for drinks only. Was so good I came back twice. Come for the food and drinks, but the lake view is a nice extra.

name: Lang Restaurant
address: Tho Da village, Kim No commune, Dong Anh district, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: "Hommage from the origin of Vietnamese Cuisine" At "Lang" restaurant, unique cuisine of the three regions in the country is to be varied and sublimated to a different level of experience that brings you not just simple food but also the real art and imagination. Refined and delicate from the selection of raw materials along with processed spices, through the hands and hearts of our talented Chef and associates, our dishes labeled with a subtle sense of tradition and modernity featuring the signature of "Lang" restaurant are just ready for you.
cuisines: Sushi Restaurants with Buffet in Hanoi
example_reviews: I went to Lang restaurant for brunch with some friends who work at Concordia International School located in the same complex with Lang. I had a special affection for it as the taste, the decoration, the design, and the service, etc have been cared much till every tiny detail. It was just perfect.
By its name, the Chocolate Volcano looks really like an active volcano. Yet it was soft and yummy.Just love the melting chocolate inside. A good start for a new day.

I have few days on my business trip in Hanoi and got one of my friend suggest this restaurant. The restaurant is clean and cozy, the staff is also very nice and friendly. I had pho bo (beff ride noodle) and cheese cake for desert. The cheese cake is very special and tasty. I highly recommend people try the cheese cake, it‚Äôs really worthy.

name: V·ªã An
address: 145 Ho√†ng C·∫ßu Q. ƒê·ªëng ƒêa, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Vi An is a Vietnamese rice restaurant, specializing in cooking traditional Vietnamese dishes in general and Hanoi's cuisine in particular. Very suitable for meeting friends, meeting partners or simply family eating together on busy days. At Com Vi An, our philosophy is simple: share the taste and culture of enjoying Vietnamese rice with everyone. We do this by using the freshest ingredients, and preparing them through the hands of dedicated chefs. With that spirit, each member of Team Vi An is always aware that serving everyone is a happiness and a joy every day. Therefore, every experience of taste, space and people is always taken into account when you choose. The space at Vi An is inspired by traditional Vietnamese values combined with modern things to create an old feeling combined with new things. With the main focus on wood and trees, the things that are most closely associated with nature will make the dining experience really different!
cuisines: Late Night Mexican Restaurants in Hanoi
Late Night Middle Eastern Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: Stumbled across this place, and boy am I glad I did . The food is outstanding and the ingredients are of extremely high quality. Price-wise, it is extremely reasonable. After dinner, I even got food for takeaway. Most importantly, my focus is always on service, the service is AMAZING. The staff are great and extremely attentive. DEFINITELY check out this spot, you won't be disappointed, I'll be going back for sure.
Delicious food. Relaxing space. Enthusiastic staff. You can eat and drink with family and friends. The restaurant is also very suitable for holding company parties, socializing, and inviting guests

name: Nikusho Japanese Wagyu Bbq

cuisines: Late Night American Restaurants in Hanoi
Asian Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
example_reviews: We stayed at the Pan Pacific hotel and found this restaurant. Although it seemed to be a new spot with a fresh team, the dinner was absolutely amazing. 2 million for 2 pax, totally worth it. Highly recommend it if you are in this area !

Little did one expect to find a fine dining Wagyu Bar-B-Que restaurant in Hanoi. A steal in terms of prices. Great value for money. Excellent service with signature Japanese courtesy. Highly recommended for those looking for a change from Vietnamese fare. And a hidden gem when compared to Wagyu restaurants in Japan or other large cities in South East Asia.

example_reviews: Friendly staff and delicious food. We had scallops, octopus, seafood fried rice and the must try Michelin on the menu Oc Toi (ordering is 1 piece/person). Scrumptious meal and generous serving perfect for 2-3 people.
Try some clams in butter, very nice place good service, good seafood, popular place, definitely recommend it

We came back here, yesterday. The restaurant had an English menu and small hanging garden. The owner is very nice! She gave us some new raincoats when it was heavy rain. We will definitely support the restaurant.

name: Papa's Dessert Caf√©
address: 10c Kh√∫c H·∫°o, Ba ƒê√¨nh, H√† N·ªôi, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Delicious cakes and drinks. The tea is very flavorful and gives off a fresh feeling. The cake is crispy and rich with cheese flavor. The indoor space is very cozy, and the outside is perfect for sitting on cool, windy days. The price is suitable for the experience and location of the cafe in the center.

example_reviews: Delicious cakes and drinks. The tea is very flavorful and gives off a fresh feeling. The cake is crispy and rich with cheese flavor. The indoor space is very cozy, and the outside is perfect for sitting on cool, windy days. The price is suitable for the experience and location of the cafe in the center.

I find the drinks suitable for my taste and the beautiful decoration suitable for all ages. Delicious cake, crispy crust, slightly sweet sauce inside, moderate fat. Overall, it's beautiful and satisfying, so come and try it out

I really like the space and service attitude of the staff. I am very satisfied with my experience at Papa's Dessert Caf√©. Various pastries, delicious coffee, comfortable sofas, very comfortable table areas, and lots of greenery.

name: Purple Cherry Restaurant
address: 1A Cua Dong Street, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: The Purple Cherry Restaurant is just renovated and open for now with new look with a better view to Hanoi city, we would like to bring you a place for chill out. Please note that, the location of the restaurant will be at 1A Cua Dong Street (East Gate of Hanoi Old Quarter). Many new dishes are added in the menu, and the local price will be our advantages to introduce Vietnamese cuisine to all of you. Please come and enjoy it! Regards,
example_reviews: We stay in Serenity diamond hotel and we have time to try the restaurant on 7th floor. The restaurant has very good view from that restaurant to see all hanoi city . The food were delicious and cheap.

We popped in for lunch and were delighted with the food, and the roof terrace is a great place to get away from the madness which is the old town. we were also so happy to chat to the staff who were interested in where we had come and were keen to practice their English. Would definitely recommend if you need a quiet break from street level
We stayed in the hotel first for two nights and then after our travels we went back because we were craving the delicious mango salad they prepare! Good place to eat.

name: LABRI - Oriental Neo Bistro
address: Hanoi Vietnam
description: LABRI is an oriental neo bistro. In French, l‚ÄôAbri means shelter. We are not a fine dining restaurant, but a neo bistro where we serve good dishes and good wine in a casual atmosphere. Every dish represents our Executive Chef‚Äôs techniques and style in cooking by using Asian ingredients with French cooking techniques.
cuisines: Asian Restaurants with Buffet in Hanoi
example_reviews: Delicious food, with exceptional service. The Restaurant has a lovely ambience, and the menu is clear and well priced. Our waitress explained the menu and when the dishes were presented she was able to guide us through each dish. I highly recommend the Iberico pork, and also the Eel Balsamic!!

Chef Joon Hyuk Chi is an extremely talented chef with a superb background, having previously worked in at Abysse, one of the hottest French restaurants in Tokyo. Chef Chi brings his talent, experience and creativity to Hanoi at LABRI. A French bistro using Asian ingredients and flavours to invent ‚Äúneo oriental‚Äù cuisine. Chef Chi is also a member of la Cha√Æne des R√¥tisseurs marking his commitment to respect for the finest form of the hospitality arts and ethical business practices.

Fantastic Dinning experience with breathtaking at Labri last night. My wife and I had a great dinner, the service was excellent and the staff very helpful which offers a big plus. The open kitchen is just great to enjoy the kitchen team meticulously preparing the food delicacies. The chef explained to us how he plays with the texture in dishes to create balance and structure. Stunning atmosphere in the restaurant. We will definitely come back soon

name: Cork & Bottle Wine Bar
address: 50 Quang An Tay Ho, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Cork and Bottle Bar provides the best possible prices on high-quality wines ‚Äì some well-known favorites, some hard-to-find selections, plenty in between. We live by a simple rule: If we wouldn‚Äôt spend our own money on a wine, we don‚Äôt make it available at Cork and Bottle Wine Bar.
cuisines: American Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
example_reviews: Came here as a group last night for the first time and we all enjoyed ourselves so much! Weds they have a happy hour(s) menu which is longer for the ladies, this was a great opportunity to sample a few of the wines in one evening. There was the option of food which a few of the group had and enjoyed (breads with camembert etc.) The guys that worked here was so lovely and attentive, the second you finished your glass of wine they were there for a top up! Highly recommend for the wines and service

Cork and Bottle Tong Dan is a charming bar that offers an intimate and relaxed atmosphere. The wine selection is very impressive! What really sets this place apart, though, is the exceptional service. Hong and Tuan went above and beyond to ensure that we felt welcomed. Their recommendations were spot-on, and they made our visit feel even more special.

Took a visiting cousin and his wife and my daughter to C&B. Such lovely, accommodating hosts and we really enjoyed the wine. We went on to another resto for dinner afterwards. Highly recommend if you like your wine.

name: Mawlana restaurant& cafe
address: No 6, alley 12 Dang Thai Mai, Tay Ho, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: MAWLANA - the only authentic Egyptian restaurant in Hanoi, serving Egyptian and Middle-Eastern dishes.
cuisines: Street Food Restaurants in Tay Ho
Fast Food Restaurants in Tay Ho
European Restaurants for Lunch in Tay Ho
Cafes for Lunch in Tay Ho
example_reviews: The shop is beautifully designed, full of Arabic style! The restaurant owner and chefs are all Egyptians üá™üá¨. They were quite friendly when I asked. My daughter really liked the restaurant and the restaurant! The taste is very easy to use and Vietnamese people can eat it every day! The mixed rice is very fragrant. I hope the minced beef and cheese noodles are my family's favorite. The price is reasonable and quite soft right in the center of Hanoi capital. Hope to come back to the capital often next time and visit the restaurant! Thank you so much!

This restaurant is the only place in Hanoi that sells authentic Egyptian food. The food is clean. The taste is what you typically get from a home made Egyptian dishes. The food is prepared fresh. The desserts are delicious. The management and chef are very helpful and accommodating. My son wanted a particular dish that wasn't on the menu. They decided to make it specially for him. I highly recommend this restaurant to everyone who visits Hanoi.

This cuisine is a great addition to the local restaurants in Tay Ho. Recommend exploring the menu for the authentic recipes tasty and full of flavour. Everything was fresh so may take a little time if you‚Äôre in a large group. But it‚Äôs worth the wait sit back and enjoy some delightful appetisers breads and dips were exceptional. A dry restaurant but none the less great evening with friends trying something new. Definitely will be back to try some more delicious food a great location for lunch or dinner.

name: My Tuong Vien
address: 23B Hai Ba Trung 2nd Floor, N04 Hoang Dao Thuy, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: We found this based on other reviews. Turned out to be one of the best restaurants we ate at our whole time in Vietnam.  Every item we ordered was spectacular especially the soup dumplings.  Expertly prepared. All the noodle dishes were also delicious. We had a large group of 11 from 2 to 72 and everyone loved it.
example_reviews: We found this based on other reviews. Turned out to be one of the best restaurants we ate at our whole time in Vietnam. Every item we ordered was spectacular especially the soup dumplings. Expertly prepared. All the noodle dishes were also delicious. We had a large group of 11 from 2 to 72 and everyone loved it.
Very good dim sum and soups. Excellent Xiao Long Bao soup dumplings and shu mai. A nice change of pace from Vietnamese food in Hanoi.
There are not a lot of options in terms of great dimsum place in Hanoi central/old quarter and this place is one of the good ones. Big selection of dimsum. which are better than its barbecue meats.

name: Shamoji Robata Yaki Hanoi
address: 25 Tong Dan Str Hoan Kiem Dist, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: A robatayaki, it is like grill bar that serves light meals and snacks of a grilled variety. The fresh produce and seafood is placed in front of you, between the grill and the counter. You can point out what you like and the japanese chef behind the counter will grill it for you. The Interior is decorated like a japanese festive market which will offer you a very special and unique atmosphere.
cuisines: Mexican Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
Middle Eastern Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
Pizza with Private Dining in Hanoi
example_reviews: I was visiting museums around the Opera House and looking for a place for lunch. This place wasn't actually on my radar, I was looking out for a couple of other highly-rated restaurants when I saw this place. It looked good from the outside, so I went in. This restaurant didn't disappoint. The food was every bit as good as in any good Japanese restaurant I've been to (and there have been quite a few, both in Japan and outside). I was a little bit hesitant ordering the fish bento, being unsure about the quality of sashimi in Hanoi. But the sashimi was totally fresh and well-prepared, as good as any sashimi I've tried. Importantly, they have a very good sake list, with plenty of options available in 180 and 300 mL flasks. It was a most delightful lunch that made my museum tour that extra bit more fun. By the way, the location of this restaurant is slightly mis-labelled on the map: It is actually right at the side of the large square building with an internal courtyard housing the History Museum.

Last week, I came here on sunday night. The restaurant was crowded. So lucky that we meet the server staff who was kind and enthusiastic . Though the restaurant was crowded, the staff was still willing to help us to order menu and recommend delicous food. We waited a long time, however they were sorry to have kept us waiting. It is so nice! Food is so good I love japanese food I love your restaurant

I love your restaurant so much I came here to be drunk with my friends. The atmosphere is animated and your food is so yummy. The staff is enthusiastic Recommendation for you who want to find a chill space Let the music runs to you Let the alcohol flows into you Sit and enjoy all !!!

name: Pharaoh's Bar & Upper
address: 54 Lieu Giai Street, Ba Dinh District 63-64F, Lotte Hotel Hanoi, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description:
This is the first of my event in Hanoi. I had a very great experience in Lotte Hanoi Hotel. I would like to say thanks to your team for support our event on 16th of July.

With heavy work due to bring a lot of equipment and many setting areas, Banquet team especially Ms Nga & Mr Vinh has discussed very careful with their leaders about delivering plan, setting lay-out and service, good service and very good location. Will definitely come again!

we are korean business in Hanoi , We often choose this place to exchange work , as well as relax after work , I highly appreciate it , Professional staff have a wide variety of drinks to choose from The manager here is very good. He keeps in touch with us so it doesn't take too long to choose and reserve a table. Thank you .

A good place to enjoy cocktails and chill with live music. Luxurious space, enthusiastic and thoughtful staff. I came on the Lady Night by one get one promotion which made me quite surprised about everything. I will definitely come back üòÉ

name: Brasserie Le Pavillon
address: 94 Ly Thuong Kiet Street Hoan Kiem District, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Very cosy and the staff are very nice and friendly. The menu has a variety of excelent local food in Ha Noi. I will definitely come here a second time.
example_reviews: Very cosy and the staff are very nice and friendly. The menu has a variety of excelent local food in Ha Noi. I will definitely come here a second time.
The meals here are very good and service is excellent. One of the better breakfast's I had in a whirlwind business trip around Vietnam
We were there for lunch and what a lovely lady Hang - She was so accommodating with our food needs. It was nice to see customer service is still live with some people, especially Hang. Kudos

name: Tu Bi Vegan Restaurant
address: 30A Ngo Truc Lac Truc Bach, Ba Dinh, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Located at 30a truc lac alley, opposite international japanese eyes hospital, Tu Bi vegan restaurant is cheapest restaurant about vegan food. The tu bi serves vegan noodle soup, fried spring rolls, fresh spring rolls, mushroom porridge and fried vegan rice
example_reviews: Clean, tasty, genuine home cooked food. My husband and son eat meat so weren‚Äôt as enthusiastic as me about going vegan. To their total delight they loved their meals as much as me! The pho was outstanding - rich flavours with tofu/tempeh and rice noodles that appeared to be homemade rather than mass produced. The spring rolls were equally flavoursome, crispy and not too oily. We also had a plate a perfectly ripe jackfruit for dessert . Great service . Good quality food . Highly recommend.

By coincidence, passing to see West lake, we saw vegan choice for lunch. Small street restaurant, friendly owner, decent offer. Ambience is not super nice but taste and offer was good and interesting and enjoyed it. Ordered noodle soup, steamed rice with veggies and fried spring rolls. Recommended

Our favorite restaurant in Hanoi. The vegan food was delicious and very reasonably priced. We had a Pho dishes which featured various vegan meats and a noodle dish. As we would be on the road the next day, we ordered strips of fried fake meat which was perfect for our packed lunch. Wish we could have tried everything!

name: Baekje Galbi
address: L√¥ C6, C7 Khu ƒêT Five Stars, Ng√µ 176 ƒê√¨nh Th√¥n Ph∆∞·ªùng M·ªπ ƒê√¨nh 1, Qu·∫≠n Nam T·ª´ Li√™m, H√† N·ªôi, Hanoi Vietnam
description: I have been living in Hanoi for a year and this place has the best reputation among Koreans for fine Korean dining. Food is top notch from meat to main dishes.  And I like not only their food but their side dishes. Unlike most of the Korean bbq places you won't come out of the restaurant smelling like one because they cook every order of your meat to your liking on the spot but also because all of the smoke will be sucked out before it even reaches my clothes. I have been here multiple times for both business and for family outings.  Most of the tables are set in a private room and they are full on every weekend evenings so I recommend making a reservation beforehand. For the quality of service and food you get, it's certainly worth every dong and  I can confidently recommend this place for someone in town.

And I like not only their food but their side dishes. Unlike most of the Korean bbq places you won't come out of the restaurant smelling like one because they cook every order of your meat to your liking on the spot but also because all of the smoke will be sucked out before it even reaches my clothes. For the quality of service and food you get, it's certainly worth every dong and I can confidently recommend this place for someone in town.

Absolutely the best Korean BBQ restaurant in Hanoi. Suitable for a formal business meeting as well as casual gathering for there are so many private rooms including VIP room which will guarantee your companies an impressive moments. Surely no more words for the food. Exactly the authentic taste of Korea - and you should try pyeongyang langmyeon(cold soup noodle) which is a nice desert-like food after having rich BBQ meal. Restaurant itself is also very clean - which I really think is important.
This is the best Korean restaurant in Hanoi. The quality of the food is quite high and the meat is very fresh. I use it a lot when meeting important clients, and the satisfaction level is high.

name: Soy Pepe
address: 591 Lac Long Quan, Hanoi Vietnam
description: Welcome to the newest addition to the culinary scene: Yu Masuda's Asian fusion restaurant! This hidden gem opened its doors in December 2022 and is sure to delight anyone looking for a unique and delicious dining experience. The restaurant is primarily tofu oriented, with Chef Yu Masuda using only the freshest and highest quality tofu from his partner and supplier, Soy Soy. Masuda is committed to creating original recipes that showcase the versatility and deliciousness of tofu, using it as the base for many of his dishes and combining it with a range of other Asian flavors and ingredients. Located in a hidden house, the restaurant offers a friendly and relaxed ambiance that's perfect for a romantic date night or a business dinner. The airy garden adds to the charm and is a wonderful spot to enjoy your meal during the warmer months. The menu at Yu Masuda's Asian fusion restaurant is a culinary adventure, featuring a range of dishes that will tantalize your taste buds. From savory soups to crispy appetizers, succulent entrees, and decadent desserts, there's something for everyone here. Vegetarians and vegans will also find plenty of options to choose from, as tofu is the star of the show. The waitstaff at this restaurant are knowledgeable and attentive, ready to guide you through the menu and suggest the perfect dish to suit your taste. Whether you're a tofu aficionado or simply looking for a delicious and unique dining experience, Yu Masuda's Asian fusion restaurant is definitely worth a visit.
cuisines: Thai Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
example_reviews: Easy going Japanese place that does superb vegan and vegetarian sets tucked away from the busy streets of Hanoi. The owner actually waited on us! Food was tasty and fresh.

This Asian restaurant truly impressed me with their tofu-focused menu. The platter I ordered was an assortment of tofu dishes, each with unique flavors and textures. From crispy bites to silky soups, every bite was a delicious surprise. The attention to detail in preparation was remarkable, with perfectly balanced flavors and just-right portion sizes. The staff was friendly. The cozy ambiance and attentive service added to the experience. If you love tofu or want to try something new, this place is a must-visit. Highly recommended !

name: Nh√† H√†ng ƒê·ªânh Th√°i Phong

cuisines: German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi

name: Phagia
address: 70 Tri·ªáu Vi·ªát V∆∞∆°ng, Hanoi Vietnam
description:
The restaurant is designed as an enchanting artistic space, where every corner exudes a delicate, gentle but equally luxurious beauty. Warm lights, gentle scents create an atmosphere that is both romantic and relaxing, ideal for memorable dates or intimate conversations.
The staff is not only attentive but also willing to meet all requests, bringing a feeling of special care.
The highlight of the restaurant is also the rich menu, each dish is a product meticulously prepared from the freshest ingredients, bringing a perfect blend of traditional and modern flavors. This is not only a place to enjoy cuisine but also a space for you to experience a feeling of relaxation, perfection and memorable. If you are looking for a special place to create valuable moments, this is the best choice.

Great vibes, amazing fusion of Italian and Japanese flavors! The food is creative and delicious, the decor is stylish, and the open bar serves top-notch drinks. The lively atmosphere, with great music, makes it the perfect spot for a fun night out. Highly recommend!

The staff here is very friendly and very helpful. They take the time to recommend food, talk and feel welcome. It was my birthday, and it felt like the whole restaurant was celebrating with me. It was a really fun and memorable experience!

name: Quan An Ngon
address: 34 Phan Dinh Phung Ba Dinh Dist, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: This place very expensive but good and fresh food. when you need the food come early you should give the tip to the staffs and then the service is faster may be they get very small salary so that why ...

German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: This place very expensive but good and fresh food. when you need the food come early you should give the tip to the staffs and then the service is faster may be they get very small salary so that why ...

I've had dinner at this restaurant in Ho Chi Minh and Ha Noi. I think the service here is much better than the one in Hoang Dao Thuy street but not good as the restaurant in Ho Chi Minh city. In my opinion, this restaurant is good for you to welcome the foreigner customer, the dishes here is definitely Vietnamse style, it makes the foreinger feel exciting and eager to taste the food. I can see the comfort in my business customer's eyes whenever I had dinner with them here. Finally, the price is expensive, just for business purpose.

We came for an early dinner about 6pm and prior to going in we checked regarding Pho and they confirmed they had it and the quantity of meat roughly in each bowl. When we were seated and decided our meal, the waitress took our order and brought us our drinks and then later came and said that they ran out of Pho soup!! I am not sure how a restaurant of this size could run out of Pho soup at 6pm!! On top of this they could not offer pineapple juice even though it is on the menu. We ended up ordering pork chops but the meat was all cut up and was quite dry - very disappointing. The restaurant looked quite nice but food was very average and on the pricey side.

name: Club Opera Novel
address: 17 Trang Tien Street Hoan Kiem District, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description:
I got engaged in this restaurant in Mar 2016.  Hubby looked for several restaurants before deciding on this months before he planned to pop the question.

We revisited this restaurant in May 2019 during our stay at Hotel de l'Opera Hanoi, just one block away.

Less people now and ambience is still nice, but food quality seemed to drop after the previous Restaurant Manager Mr. Thuy left.
cuisines: Middle Eastern Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
Pizza with Private Dining in Hanoi
Seafood Restaurants for Large Groups in Hanoi
example_reviews: I got engaged in this restaurant in Mar 2016. Hubby looked for several restaurants before deciding on this months before he planned to pop the question. We revisited this restaurant in May 2019 during our stay at Hotel de l'Opera Hanoi, just one block away. Less people now and ambience is still nice, but food quality seemed to drop after the previous Restaurant Manager Mr. Thuy left.

Six of us staying at the Hanoi-Sofitel Legend Metropole wanted a Vietnamese restaurant close by for our first night in Hanoi. Club Opera Novel was on the hotel recommended list so we all tried it. There is a nice ambience in the restaurant and a couple of the wait staff spoke English. The Fried Spring rolls were a great surprise and were served pegged by toothpick to a hollowed out pineapple illuminated by a candle beneath. The rolls were outstanding and crunchy. I highly recommend this appetizer! I had the fried sea bass which turned out to be fish medallions fried with a nice sauce. It was just okay. My other friend chose the steamed Grouper in tea leaves which she enjoyed. As a side we ordered the eggplant which I thought had too much sauce. Nevertheless the eggplant tasted good. In summary, this is s good restaurant with a good variety. The only issue I had was that four of us received their dinner but mine took another 15 min. Prices are 4 star but the quality is good.

We ate here twice during our brief stay in Hanoi. The first time was lunch and we were the only people in there. We tried the spring rolls (crab/pork) and the Imperial style, pho, glass noodle with crab and Australian beef stir fry. Then for dinner with another couple and once again everything was delicious. Service was lovely too.

name: The Atlas Beer Collector
description:
Atlas was very close to our hotel and we stumbled on it looking for a local draft beer. The selection was great and the staff was wonderful!  We enjoyed it so much we returned for dinner. Everything was excellent. The atlas
Fried rice was amazing. Can‚Äôt say enough about the staff and the food.
example_reviews: Atlas was very close to our hotel and we stumbled on it looking for a local draft beer. The selection was great and the staff was wonderful! We enjoyed it so much we returned for dinner. Everything was excellent. The atlas Fried rice was amazing. Can‚Äôt say enough about the staff and the food.

What a wonderful spot. Close to our hotel so we went there after a long flight. The staff was very nice, they have a good selection of beer and the food was excellent. This is the second time we‚Äôve dined there and both times were wonderful.

The Atlas - Beer Collector is a haven for beer enthusiasts. Its clean and inviting ambiance creates the perfect atmosphere for enjoying a diverse range of beers. The collection is impressive, offering a delightful journey through various flavors and brews. A must-visit spot for those who appreciate the art of beer without the distraction of food.

name: V-Cuisine
address: 31 Ma May Hang Buom, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: My restaurant have rice , fried frice, egg noodle , pho noodle , rice noodle . and vegetarian food . So clean , so cheap ...
example_reviews: Found by chance and ordered chicken noodles and shrip fried rice with a Hanoi beer and diet coke. Food came steaming hot from the kitchen, served with a smile and tasted great. Sjrimps like king prawns and chicken super tender. Came to ¬£8.50! Enough for 2 to share. Highly recommended!

We found this great family run restaurant just off the night market. It offers excellent value for money and all the dishes we tried were wonderful and full of flavour. Service was quick and friendly. I would not hesitate to recommend this restaurant, you will not be disappointed.

The servings are a good size and great value. The shredded chicken salad comes with peanuts on top and was delicious. Sometimes the service was great but one time we ordered 2 dishes, only 1 turned up and when we asked about the 2nd it still didn't turn up so we gave up and left. Still worth going again then we discovered another V-Cuisine just around the corner (29 P. H√†ng Gi·∫ßy, H√†ng Bu·ªìm, Ho√†n Ki·∫øm, H√† N·ªôi, Vietnam) with the same menu and more reliable service.

name: Beatro - Gastro Lounge
address: 1 Tr√†ng Ti·ªÅn, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Beatro - Cafe, Eatery & Bar offers a contemporary interpretation of Milanese cuisine in modern, chic & vibrant setting which stays true to Italian origins.
example_reviews: The music and ambience here were perfect. We don‚Äôt expect such a warm and relaxing service right behind The Opera House. White wine pairing with cold cut and chilled seafood were perfect for a summer day.

I was here with my husband when we had a few days of vacation in Hanoi and this was a perfect restaurant we found. Ideal place for couples. We ordered a few different dishes and each one was delicious! The crab pasta here makes me impressed. It‚Äôs the first time we tried to eat a whole crab, even its skin. It‚Äôs fantastically delicious and I really liked it. Highly recommend!

We really enjoyed our fine dining here. Food and wine all lovely and well cooked. We especially loved the squid dish and the yummy chocolate lava cake. Only downside was they didn‚Äôt serve tea or coffee after the meal which is quite a disappointment as we had to leave and go to another cafe just for a meal end drink!

name: Little Vietnam
address: 24 Ly Quoc Su Hang Buom, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: This place has some good food. My girlfriend had a pho vegetarian dish with some great flavours and I had a rice with chicken black pepper sauce which was also quite good. An unfortunate let down from a possible excellent experience is the eating area isn‚Äôt very clean or regularly maintained with bins and tables. Still otherwise good, cheap food.

example_reviews: This place has some good food. My girlfriend had a pho vegetarian dish with some great flavours and I had a rice with chicken black pepper sauce which was also quite good. An unfortunate let down from a possible excellent experience is the eating area isn‚Äôt very clean or regularly maintained with bins and tables. Still otherwise good, cheap food.

The place was crowded and a little crammed. We had to share tables but that's no issue at all. It didn't take long to serve our orders. The grill chicken is blend but the photo make it looks so tasty. The pho was okay. Their price is good. It's packed,so it's not possible to hang around as many people are standing, waiting for a seat. We just eat and leave immediately.
Absolutly marvulous. Hot plate, deer and duck were just amazing. Good wine by glass at reasonable price. Staff very friendly. We return the next Day.

name: M·ªÖ - Mexican Fusion Bites
address: 2c Tong Duy Tan, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Never would have expected such delicious Mexican food in Hanoi. Cody did a fantastic job!  We got the DIY burrito with pork, rice, sweet Mexi, chili corn mix, and tasty cheese. It was large and delicious! We also got the ‚ÄúNice but weird fried‚Äù which were like nacho fries. It was all so very good! Wonderful job, Cody!
example_reviews: Never would have expected such delicious Mexican food in Hanoi. Cody did a fantastic job! We got the DIY burrito with pork, rice, sweet Mexi, chili corn mix, and tasty cheese. It was large and delicious! We also got the ‚ÄúNice but weird fried‚Äù which were like nacho fries. It was all so very good! Wonderful job, Cody!
Great place with the best Mexican food in Hanoi. We‚Äôve eaten here all week on our vacation. The service is great too, can highly recommend.

name: KANN - Hidden Cafe & Lounge
address: 7 Ng√µ G·∫°ch, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: KANN - Hidden Cafe & Lounge is a hidden gem in the heart of Hanoi, offering a unique blend of tranquility and sophistication. Tucked away from the bustling streets, KANN provides a cozy and stylish retreat where guests can indulge in premium coffee, artisanal beverages, and handcrafted cocktails. Designed with an intimate and modern aesthetic, KANN is the perfect destination for those seeking a peaceful coffee break, a productive workspace, or an elegant lounge experience in the evening. Whether you're looking to unwind with a book, catch up with friends, or enjoy a curated selection of drinks in a relaxed atmosphere, KANN delivers a warm and welcoming ambiance.
example_reviews: This spot is amazing for some good drinks. The cocktails we had were amazing and the staff is super attentive. Service in Vietnam is generally already good but here it's really another level. Trying to exceed the expectation of people with their products and services.
Good relaxed atmosphere and staff are friendly. Saigon beer is good and the cocktails are ok but the alcohol is quite weak.
Newly opened bar:,Staff and service exceptional. Could not have been more helpful and determined to make the guest experience perfect. Warm welcome assured here.

name: Hoi An Roastery - Espresso & Coffee House
address: 32 Hang Be Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: Hoi An Roastery at 32 Hang Be, Hanoi is a professional Espresso-Coffee House-Restaurant where people have various choices of Excellent and Delicious Vietnamese Coffees such as Egg Coffee, Coconut Ice Blended Coffee, Caf√© Sua Da (Vietnamese Coffee with condensed milk), Drinks and Desserts at very reasonable price. Our local staffs are very nice, dedicated and helpful to interact with you :). They are always happy to provide free information to customers to having the most interesting & cheapest travel options. We also develop our business with the low income coffee and tea producers, living in far and remote mountainous areas through inclusive business development with supports of NGOs (non-government organisations), international development agencies of developed countries. We offer the visit to the coffee and tea villages and interact with the ethnic minority farmers wit whom we work. We offer shared transfer car for $2/pax and private transfer car for only $9 to the airport/hotels.
cuisines: Late Night Mediterranean Restaurants in Hanoi
Middle Eastern Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi
example_reviews: The restaurant here has a lot of dishes, in which the pho I find is quite delicious, the chicken broth is tender, the noodles are also soft. In addition, the shop also sells egg coffee that I always want to try. At first, I thought putting eggs in the coffee would have a fishy smell, but it's not fishy, it's quite fragrant, a unique flavor. I also saw the shop listed in the menu of chrysanthemum tea drinks, they put dried chrysanthemums and a few other ingredients I don't know what it is but it looks very beautiful and luxurious.

Had an awesome time here. Kelvin was our waiter and you could tell that he took pleasure in his job, was extremely helpful and friendly and made us feel right at home. Highly recommend as a great place to try Vietnamese coffee!

We came across this great little cafe while wandering the streets of the Old Quarter. We enjoyed the most delicious coconut coffee and cheesecake, served by lovely and informative staff. Truly atmospheric sitting in comfortable ground floor lounges watching the world go by...

name: Aahar Indian Restaurant
address: 54 P. H√†ng Gai, Hanoi 110000 Vietnam
description: In our group there were trip members who prefer Indian food even during travelling abroad. Aahar was the answer and this eatery was just few meters away from our hotel. So, we ordered and enjoyed butter and garlic nan, dal makhani, panner tikka, butter chicken, mixed vegetable, and what not. All the group members enjoyed quality and tasty typical Indian style dishes thoroughly. Finally, we'd masala tea to wrap the session. It was truly a pleasant experience not just for the quality of food and ambiance, but also service of staff. Sensed they try their best to satisfy travelers. Price is also reasonable and so South Asian tourists should try this place for having quality food of their own taste.
cuisines: French Restaurants with Private Dining in Hanoi
German Restaurants for Lunch in Hanoi

So, we ordered and enjoyed butter and garlic nan, dal makhani, panner tikka, butter chicken, mixed vegetable, and what not. The garlic naan was truly delicious, hot and piping, paired perfectly with the rich flavors of paneer butter masala and fried rice. During the rainy season, the masala chai at this place felt like a true blessing. Conversation with the restaurant owner added a special touch to the overall experience. Dining here was really enjoyable!

Aahaar restaurant, located in Old Quarters of Hanoi, gives you an experience of Indian food away from home. Since this restaurant was near our hotel, we used to visit it when craving home food. The quality of the food is excellent both in taste and presentation. They maintain perfect hygiene. The lady who runs the restaurant, Lan, is very hospitable and enquires at each table about the well being of guests. Even the price is reasonable. Try their daal fry, rolls, chicken curry, naan and keema matar.

name: Banh Mi Vui
address: No 7 Hang Da, Cua Dong Ward, Hoan Kiem Disctric, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: The Local Banh Mi store in the Old quater, main center of Hanoi. We are providing the healthy and fresh meal to the customer. The delicious taste will make you happy like our brand name.
cuisines: Late Night Sushi Restaurants in Hanoi
Late Night Vietnamese Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: My husband and I were so lucky to find this B√°nh M√¨ place in Hanoi's Old Quarter. It is a little off the beaten track and we only happened onto it while shopping for traditional Vietnamese sweets across the street. We tried two different types of B√°nh M√¨ which were both delicious as I am sure everything else is in this restaurant. All ingredients are fresh and tasty. The shop owner is very nice as is her son who speaks English and who sometimes helps out his mother. I hope to go back one day to try the other things on the menu. There are other B√°nh M√¨ places closer to the cathedral, but this one is by far superior.

this is my first experience about banh mi. it was so good, the bread is so soft and other toppings are perfect. and I had 2 drinks cuz so hot weather, they are nice too. avocado rich taste and kind of lemon things make me feel fresh. also very nice staff who can speak English so well.

This is the best banh mi in Hanoi for me! I‚Äôve tried Banh Mi 25 as it‚Äôs super hyped up by others and while Banh Mi 25 is good, Banh Mi Vui beats them when it comes to toppings and quite frankly Banh Mi Vui tastes just as good if not even better than Banh Mi 25. Also, their milk iced coffee is the best! Definitely my favorite banh mi and iced coffee in Hanoi. If you‚Äôre reading this review please come and try it. I love their beef with mozzarela cheese banh mi.

name: Anh Tuyet
address: 25 Ma May, Hang Buom, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: Recommended by our Exo Travel Rep as they use this restaurant for cookery class tours, we asked for a table to be booked for us and went along. We were shown to our table by a young girl who had limited English and saw only one other person the whole evening - a young lad that came in and went upstairs to what I presume was the kitchen and then wandered back outside again. We had the honey chicken having read about it on TA but this was thigh chicken and most of the flavour was on the skin which I don't often eat so lacking in taste for me. Had sticky rice which was okay but nothing special. We had spring rolls to start - a few small pieces in very nice sauce though. Finished with banana fritters which were lovely - in syrup with peanuts. Whole meal was 410,000 VD. There was no atmosphere and the girl spent the whole night on her mobile phone texting and talking. We were there about an hour and were really disappointed.
example_reviews: Recommended by our Exo Travel Rep as they use this restaurant for cookery class tours, we asked for a table to be booked for us and went along. We were shown to our table by a young girl who had limited English and saw only one other person the whole evening - a young lad that came in and went upstairs to what I presume was the kitchen and then wandered back outside again. We had the honey chicken having read about it on TA but this was thigh chicken and most of the flavour was on the skin which I don't often eat so lacking in taste for me. Had sticky rice which was okay but nothing special. We had spring rolls to start - a few small pieces in very nice sauce though. Finished with banana fritters which were lovely - in syrup with peanuts. Whole meal was 410,000 VD. There was no atmosphere and the girl spent the whole night on her mobile phone texting and talking. We were there about an hour and were really disappointed.

I came here many years ago and had the best chicken I had ever eaten. After seeing it on Anthony Bourdain's show, I was fortunate to come and try the chicken cooked by madam Tuyet herself. Unfortunately now the charm has gone. It's still run by the Tuyet family but clearly the desire to be the best is not as important now and the restaurant is empty. Such a pity. I hope they read trip advisor and take this as constructive feedback. The same chicken I ordered years ago that I have told so many people was the best ever is now just ok.

Another great recommendation that we got. Went here and found the place. The entrance (and walk up to the restaurant) isn't much but the food was great. We asked for suggestions and the choices were great. A must visit.

name: Mai Anh Pho Ga
address: 32 Le Van Huu, Hai Ba Trung, Hanoi 10000 Vietnam
description: We came here because the the Obama "bun cha" place next door was rammed. Good choice though. The chicken pho was lovely and fresh, you get plenty of limes and chillies to spice it up. However, my Saigon family thought it was heavy on the spring onions. The Hanoi beer was nice and cold, perfect Tuesday lunch.
cuisines: Late Night Sushi Restaurants in Hanoi
example_reviews: We came here because the the Obama "bun cha" place next door was rammed. Good choice though. The chicken pho was lovely and fresh, you get plenty of limes and chillies to spice it up. However, my Saigon family thought it was heavy on the spring onions. The price is quite higher than other places but the quality worth it. Everything is fresh and delicious.

name: Vua Cha Ca
address: 09 Ly Thuong Kiet Hoan Kiem, Hanoi 100000 Vietnam
description: My go-to place for a fix for Hanoi's famous grilled fish. The pre-grilled fish pieces were huge, to be cooked again with oil and herbs, then eaten with rice noddle, peanut and shrimp paste. Just a super delicious meal in a cold day with friends/family. My favourite was due still the traditional Cha ca La Vong restaurant in Old quarter ( the shrimp paste theee is superd) but due to this one's spacious table, this is more suitable for big crowd and kids. Service was good, staff was quick to response to request, polite and efficient. Recommend to get the set with fish hot pot at the end, yum yum
cuisines: Late Night Thai Restaurants in Hanoi
